EditMode.description:
Description: Whether to render the gauge in edit mode? In edit mode, user can drag and rotate the dial to new values.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ValueBelowPivot.description:
Description: Whether to show dial value below the pivot or above it?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

TrendValueDistance.description:
Description: Distance between trend values and tick lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

AutoAlignTickValues.description:
Description: Whether to ask the chart to automatically place tick values to reduce overlapping of the tick values with the gauge.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

GaugeStartAngle.description:
Description: Angle from where the gauge will start drawing. Please see the section Configuring angles & origin to learn more about this. Default value is 180.
      Type: Number
      Range: -360-360

GaugeEndAngle.description:
Description: Angle where the gauge will end drawing. Please see the section Configuring angles & origin to learn more about this. Default value is 0.
      Type: Number
      Range: -360-360

GaugeOuterRadius.description:
Description: Outer radius for the color range scale.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

GaugeInnerRadius.description:
Description: Inner radius for color range scale. It can either be in exact pixels or in percentage of outer radius. For example, if the value of `gaugeOuterRadius` attribute is `10` and the value of `gaugeInnerRadius` attribute is set to `50%`, the value of `gaugeInnerRadius` will be calculated and set as 5px, i.e. 50% of 10.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels or in percentage

GaugeFillMix.description:
Description: This attribute specifies the gradient fill formula for the gauge scale. Example: `{light-10},{light-20},{light-60}` 

 __Note:__ This attribute is not supported in IE8
      Type: String

GaugeFillRatio.description:
Description: This attribute sets the ratio of each color separated by comma using `gaugeFillMix` attribute.
      Type: Number separated by commas

PivotRadius.description:
Description: Radius of the pivot.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

PivotFillColor.description:
Description: Fill color for the pivot.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

PivotFillAlpha.description:
Description: Fill alpha for the pivot.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

PivotFillAngle.description:
Description: Angle for fill (if linear gradient).
      Type: Number
      Range: 0-360

PivotFillType.description:
Description: Whether to fill as linear gradient or radial gradient (if gradient at all)?
      Type: linear or radial

PivotFillMix.description:
Description: This attribute specifies the gradient fill formula for the pivot. Example: `{light-10},{light-20},{light-60}` 

 __Note:__ This attribute is not supported in IE8
      Type: String

PivotFillRatio.description:
Description: This attribute sets the ratio of each color separated by comma using `pivotFillMix` attribute.
      Type: Number separated by commas

ShowPivotBorder.description:
Description: Whether to show border for the pivot?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

PivotBorderThickness.description:
Description: Border thickness for pivot.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

PivotBorderColor.description:
Description: Border color for pivot.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

PivotBorderAlpha.description:
Description: Border alpha for pivot.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

Pivotbgcolor.description:
Description: This attribute fills the background color of the pivot.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

DialbgHoverColor.description:
Description: This attribute sets the background color of the gauges dial when hovered.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex color code

DialbgHoverAlpha.description:
Description: This attribute sets the transparency of the gauges dial when hovered.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

DialBorderHoverColor.description:
Description: Sets the border color for the dial of the gauge when hovered.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex color code

DialBorderHoverAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the transparency for the dials border of the gauge when hovered.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

DialBorderHoverThickness.description:
Description: Sets the thickness for the dials border of the gauge when hovered.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

BaseWidth.description:
Description: Width of the bottom part of the dial (the part connected to pivot).
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

Id.description:
Description: Each dial can have a unique ID, using which it can be referred to in JavaScript and real-time data updates.
      Type: String

Radius.description:
Description: Radius for the dial (in pixels).
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

RearExtension.description:
Description: If you want the dial to extend beyond the pivot (in opposite side) for more realistic looks, you can set the extension distance (in pixels) using this attribute.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

TopWidth.description:
Description: Width of the top part of dial.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

ValueX.description:
Description: Whether to place value textbox x-position?
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

ValueY.description:
Description: Whether to place value textbox y-position?
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

BaseRadius.description:
Description: Radius to be applied to the vertices of the pivot end of the dial. Default value is `0`. Use this attribute along with non-zero `rearExtension` for better visualization. This attribute is not applicable if a `topWidth` is applied to the dial.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

MarkerBorderColor.description:
Description: Border color of marker.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

MarkerColor.description:
Description: Fill color of marker.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

MarkerRadius.description:
Description: Radius of the marker.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

MarkerTooltext.description:
Description: You can define the tooltip for a marker using this attribute.
      Type: String

UseMarker.description:
Description: You can opt to show a triangular marker for each trend-point by setting this attribute to 1.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ValueInside.description:
Description: Whether to display the trend-point value inside the gauge?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

AxisLineAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the transparency of the x-axis line. Will work only when _showxaxisline_ is set to 1.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

ShowAlternateVGridColor.description:
Description: Whether to show alternate colored vertical grid bands.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

AlternateVGridColor.description:
Description: Color of the alternate vertical grid bands.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

AlternateVGridAlpha.description:
Description: Alpha (transparency) of the alternate vertical grid bands.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

DrawCrossLineOnTop.description:
Description: This attribute is used to determine if the cross line will be drawn above the data plot or below the data plot. 

Default value: __0__
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ExportCallback.description:
Description: Name of JavaScript function that'll be called back when export process has finished in case of:Client side exportBatch exportServer-side export using 'save' as action
      Type: String

MaxBarHeight.description:
Description: Sets the maximum allowed bar height.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

BarHoverColor.description:
Description: This attribute specifies the hover color for the bars.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

BarHoverAlpha.description:
Description: This attribute specifies the transparency of the bar when you hover.
      Type: Number
      Range: 1 - 100

ShowMinValues.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to show or hide the minimum value of the set of data provided.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowMaxValues.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to show or hide the maximum value of the set of data provided.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowQ1Values.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to show or hide the lower quartile value of the set of data provided.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowQ3Values.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to show or hide the upper quartile value of the set of data provided.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowMedianValues.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to show or hide the median value of the set of data provided.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

MedianColor.description:
Description: This attribute sets the color of the line which is used to represent the median.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

MedianThickness.description:
Description: This attribute sets the thickness of the line which is used to represent the median.
      Type: Number

MedianAlpha.description:
Description: This attribute sets the transparency of the line which is used to represent the median.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

ShowMean.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to show or hide the icon representing the mean value of the set of data provided.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowSD.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to show or hide the icon representing the standard deviation value of the set of data provided.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowQD.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to show or hide the icon representing the quartile deviation value of the set of data provided.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowMD.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to show or hide the icon representing the mean deviation value of the set of data provided.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

MeanIconShape.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the shape of the mean icon.
      Type: string
      Range: polygon/spoke

MeanIconRadius.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the radius of the mean icon.
      Type: Number

MeanIconSides.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set number of sides of the mean icon.
      Type: Number

MeanIconColor.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the color of the mean icon.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

MeanIconAlpha.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the transparency of the mean icon.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

SDIconShape.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the shape of the standard deviation icon.
      Type: string
      Range: polygon/spoke

SDIconRadius.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the radius of the standard deviation icon.
      Type: Number

SDIconSides.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the number of sides of the standard deviation icon.
      Type: Number

SDIconColor.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the color of the standard deviation icon.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

SDIconAlpha.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the transparency of the standard deviation icon.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

QDIconShape.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the shape of the quartile deviation icon.
      Type: String
      Range: polygon/spoke

QDIconRadius.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the radius of the quartile deviation icon.
      Type: Number

QDIconSides.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the number of sides of the quartile deviation icon.
      Type: Number

QDIconColor.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the color of the quartile deviation icon.

      Range: Hex Color Code

QDIconAlpha.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the transparency of the quartile deviation icon.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

MDIconShape.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the shape of the median icon.
      Type: String
      Range: polygon/spoke

MDIconRadius.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the radius of the median icon.
      Type: Number

MDIconSides.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the number of sides of the median icon.

MDIconColor.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the color of the median icon.

      Range: Hex Color Code

MDIconAlpha.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the transparency of the median icon.

DrawMeanConnector.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to draw a line connecting all the mean icons of multiple set of data.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

DrawSDConnector.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to draw a line connecting all the standard deviation icons of multiple set of data.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

DrawQDConnector.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to draw a line connecting all the quartile deviation icons of multiple set of data.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

DrawMDConnector.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to draw a line connecting all the mean deviation icons of multiple set of data.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

OutlierIconShape.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the shape of the icon representing the outliers.

      Range: polygon/spoke

OutlierIconRadius.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the radius of the icon representing the outliers.

OutlierIconSides.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the number of sides of the icon representing the outliers.

OutlierIconColor.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the color of the icon representing the outliers.

OutlierIconAlpha.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the transparency of the icon representing the outliers.
      Type: Number

WhiskersLimitsWidthRatio.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the width of the upper and lower whiskers in percentage with respect to the width of the dataplot.

ShowAllOutliers.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to show or hide the outlier values of the data plots.
      Type: Boolean

OutliersUpperRangeRatio.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the upper limit of the y-axis to display the outlier values which are greater than the default upper limit of the y-axis.

OutliersLowerRangeRatio.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the lower limit of the y-axis to display the outlier values which are smaller than the default lower limit of the y-axis.
      Type: Number

ShowMinValue.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to show or hide the minimum value of the set of data provided.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowMaxValue.description:

      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowQ1Value.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to show or hide the lower quartile value of the set of data provided.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowQ3Value.description:

      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowMedianValue.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to show or hide the median value of the set of data provided.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

Outliers.description:
Description: This attribute specifies the outliers or the values which are greater than the maximum number of the set of data provided.
      Type: Number

BubbleScale.description:
Description: If you want to proportionately increase/decrease size of all the bubbles on the chart, you can use this attribute. A value of less than 1 (but greater than 0) will decrease all the bubble sizes and vice versa.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0-2

MinBubbleRadius.description:
Description: This attribute lets you define a default minimum radius for the bubbles. This is needed to ensure that all bubbles are visible.
      Type: Number

Showxaxisline.description:
Description: This attribute if set to _0_, hides the x-axis of the chart. 

__Default value__: 1
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

BubbleHoverColor.description:
Description: This attribute specifies the hover color for the bubbles.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

BubbleHoverAlpha.description:
Description: This attribute specifies the transparency of the bubble when hovered.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

BubbleHoverScale.description:
Description: This attribute sets the scale of bubble when hovered.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

Is3dOnHover.description:
Description: Whether to show 3D bubble on hover. If not specified, the effect is guided by is3D attribute.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

HoverScale.description:
Description: This attribute scales the bubbles on hover.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

Z.description:
Description: Z-axis numerical value for the set of data. The size of bubble will depend on this value (with respect to z values of other bubbles on the chart).
      Type: Number
      Range: Numeric Value

Showtrendlinelabels.description:
Description: It sets the configuration whether the trend line labels will be displayed or not.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

AutoScale.description:
Description: If you've defined the chart parameters (like gauge origin, co-ordinates etc.) using a different chart size and now want to scale the chart to a different size, you need to specify the original width and height and then set this attribute to 1.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

OrigW.description:
Description: If you've opted to dynamically resize the chart, you can convey the original width of chart using this attribute. It refers to the width based on which you had defined the various co-ordinates/radius of the gauge. For example, if you had designed a gauge with 300 px width and in that you had set the gauge radius to be 100, then you can use the dynamic resizing feature and specify `origW='300'`. It will automatically check the current width and scale the radius etc. appropriately. Please note that both the original width and height of the chart need to be set. To know more on how this attribute works, please read Angular Gauge > Dynamic Resizing page.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

OrigH.description:
Description: If you've opted to dynamically resize the chart, you can convey the original height of chart using this attribute. It refers to the height based on which you had defined the various co-ordinates/radius of the gauge. For example, if you had designed a gauge with 300 px height and in that you had set the gauge radius to be 100, then you can use the dynamic resizing feature and specify `origH='300'`. It will automatically check the current height and scale the radius etc. appropriately. Please note that both the original width and height of the chart need to be set. To know more on how this attribute works, please read Angular Gauge > Dynamic Resizing page.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

UseColorNameAsValue.description:
Description: Whether to use the color range label as value or show the actual numerical value?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

PlaceValuesInside.description:
Description: Whether to place values inside the bulb or below it?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

RefreshInstantly.description:
Description: By default, the real-time charts wait for a few seconds after rendering for the first time and before updating itself with new data. To allow the chart to start updating itself as soon as it is rendered, set this attribute to 1.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

DataStreamURL.description:
Description: This parameter sets the path of the page which is supposed to relay real-time data to the chart. If you've special characters as a part of your data stream URL, like `?` or `&`, you'll need to URL Encode the entire `dataStreamURL`. This page needs to be on the same sub-domain on which the chart is hosted and invoked from.
      Type: URL

RefreshInterval.description:
Description: For this parameter, you can specify the number of seconds after which the chart will look for new data. This process will happen continuously - i.e., if you specify 5 seconds here, the chart will look for new data every 5 seconds.
      Type: Number
      Range: In seconds

DataStamp.description:
Description: Constantly changing data stamp that can be added to real time Data URL, so as to maintain a state. Please see the section Real time capabilities > Adding data stamp
      Type: String

ShowRTMenuItem.description:
Description: Whether to show the real-time update related menu items (like Start/Stop Update) in chart's context menu? Note: For JavaScript charts real-time update related menu items do not appear by default. You need to explicitly set `'showRTMenuItem': '1'` in the `chart` object. The menu appears as a button on the bottom-left corner of the JavaScript chart. You can then use the button to Start/Stop Update or Clear chart.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

GaugeFillAlpha.description:
Description: Fill alpha for the bulb.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

GaugeOriginX.description:
Description: If you want to specify your origin X for the bulb, please use this attribute.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

GaugeOriginY.description:
Description: If you want to specify your origin Y for the bulb, please use this attribute.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

GaugeRadius.description:
Description: Your custom radius for the bulb.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

ShowGaugeBorder.description:
Description: Whether to show a border around bulb?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

GaugeBorderColor.description:
Description: Color of bulb border. You can either specify a hex code here (like `333333`), or a single token from gradient fill mix like `{dark-20}` or `{light-30}`. The chart will then calculate the border color for each color range individually (based on the color code for each color range).
      Type: Color Code or Fill Mix formula (but single token)
      Range: Hex Code or token from gradient fill mix

GaugeBorderThickness.description:
Description: Thickness of bulb border.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

GaugeBorderAlpha.description:
Description: Alpha of bulb border.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

Is3D.description:
Description: Whether to render the bulb in 2D or 3D mode? By default, the chart is displayed in 3D mode.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

UpperLimit.description:
Description: This attribute helps you explicitly set the upper limit of the chart. If you don't specify this value, the chart automatically calculates the upper limit based on the data provided by you.
      Type: Number

LowerLimit.description:
Description: This attribute helps you explicitly set the lower limit of the chart. If you don't specify this value, the chart automatically calculates the lower limit based on the data provided by you.
      Type: Number

UseMessageLog.description:
Description: Whether to use message logger for the chart?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

MessageLogWPercent.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set the width percent of the message logger window w.r.t entire chart width. So, if you set it as 80, the message logger window will take up 80% of chart width.
      Type: Number
      Range: In percent

MessageLogHPercent.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set the height percent of the message logger window w.r.t entire chart height.
      Type: Number
      Range: In percent

MessageLogShowTitle.description:
Description: Whether to show the title for message logger?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

MessageLogTitle.description:
Description: If you've opted to show the title for message logger, you can define your custom title here. Examples are "Error log", "Server History" etc. The title displays at the top left corner of chart.
      Type: String

MessageLogColor.description:
Description: You can customize the color of the entire message log window by setting a hex value for this attribute.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

MessageGoesToLog.description:
Description: The messages streamed to the chart can either be displayed in the message log window or can be passed to JavaScript (which we'll see next). This attribute lets you control whether the messages should be logged in the in-built log window.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

MessageGoesToJS.description:
Description: This attribute lets you configure whether each message streamed from the server should be passed to a local JavaScript function.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

MessageJSHandler.description:
Description: If you've opted to pass each message to JavaScript function, this attribute lets you define the name of the function. This helps you create your custom functions to react to messages streamed from server.
      Type: String

MessagePassAllToJS.description:
Description: Whether to pass all message envelope parameters to the custom JavaScript function.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

FormatNumber.description:
Description: This configuration determines whether the numbers displayed on the chart will be formatted using commas, e.g., 40,000 if 'formatNumber': '1'; and 40000 if 'formatNumber': '0';.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

NumberPrefix.description:
Description: Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all dollars figure on the chart, you could specify this attribute to $ to show like $40000, $50000.
      Type: String

NumberSuffix.description:
Description: Using this attribute, you could add suffix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all figures quantified as per annum on the chart, you could specify this attribute to '/a' to show like 40000/a, 50000/a.
      Type: String

Decimals.description:
Description: Number of decimal places to which all numbers on the chart will be rounded to.
      Type: Number

ForceDecimals.description:
Description: Whether to add 0 padding at the end of decimal numbers? For example, if you set decimals as 2 and a number is 23.4. If `forceDecimals` is set to 1, the number will automatically be converted to 23.40 (note the extra 0 at the end).
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

FormatNumberScale.description:
Description: Configuration whether to add K (thousands) and M (millions) to a number after truncating and rounding it - e.g., if `formatNumberScale` is set to 1, 1043 will become 1.04K (with decimals set to 2 places). Same with numbers in millions - an M will be added at the end.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

DefaultNumberScale.description:
Description: The default unit of the numbers that you're providing to the chart.
      Type: String

NumberScaleUnit.description:
Description: Unit of each block of the scale.
      Type: String

NumberScaleValue.description:
Description: Range of the various blocks that constitute the scale.
      Type: String

ForceNumberScale.description:
Description: If a data value is less than the lowest given number is the number scale, this attribute forces the lower value of the  `numberScaleUnit` to be applied to that data value.  This attribute works only when `formatNumberScale: 1` and the `defaultNumberScale` attribute is not defined. 

For example, if `numberScaleUnit: K, M`, `numberScaleValue: 1000, 1000`, and `forceNumberScale: 1`, a data value of __400__ will be rendered as __0.40K__.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ScaleRecursively.description:
Description: Whether recursive scaling should be applied.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

MaxScaleRecursion.description:
Description: How many recursions to complete during recursive scaling? -1 completes the entire set of recursion.
      Type: Number

ScaleSeparator.description:
Description: What character to use to separate the scales that are generated after recursion?
      Type: String

DecimalSeparator.description:
Description: This attribute helps you specify the character to be used as the decimal separator in a number.
      Type: String

ThousandSeparator.description:
Description: This attribute helps you specify the character to be used as the thousands separator in a number.
      Type: String

ThousandSeparatorPosition.description:
Description: This option helps you specify the position of the thousand separator.
      Type: Number

InDecimalSeparator.description:
Description: In some countries, commas are used as decimal separators and dots as thousand separators. In XML/JSON, if you specify such values, it will give an error while converting to number. The chart accepts the input decimal and thousand separator from user, so that it can convert it accordingly into the required format. This attribute lets you input the decimal separator.
      Type: String

InThousandSeparator.description:
Description: In some countries, commas are used as decimal separators and dots as thousand separators. In XML/JSON, if you specify such values, it will give an error while converting to number. The chart accepts the input decimal and thousand separator from user, so that it can convert it accordingly into the required format. This attribute lets you input the thousand separator.
      Type: String

Valuefontsize.description:
Description: This attribute specifies the size of the font displayed at the center of the bulb.
      Type: Number
      Range: 6 - 72

ShowToolTipShadow.description:
Description: Whether to show shadow for tooltips.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

Tooltipbgalpha.description:
Description: Sets the transparency of the tooltip.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

Tooltipborderradius.description:
Description: Sets the border radius of the tooltip.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

Tooltipborderthickness.description:
Description: Sets the border thickness of the tooltip.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

ToolTipPadding.description:
Description: This attribute sets the vertical space between the value and the border of the tooltip. If you want more space between the value and the border, you can use this attribute to control it.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

GaugeFillHoverColor.description:
Description: This attribute sets the hover color for the bulb.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex color code

GaugeFillHoverAlpha.description:
Description: This attribute sets the transparency of the bulb when hovered.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

Is3donHover.description:
Description: Sets whether to render the bulb in 3D mode when hovered.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowgaugeBorderonHover.description:
Description: Sets whether to show the border of the bulb when hovered.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

GaugeBorderHoverColor.description:
Description: Sets the color for border of the bulb when hovered.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex color code

GaugeBorderHoverAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the transparency for the border of bulb when hovered.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

GaugeBorderHoverThickness.description:
Description: Sets the thickness for the border of bulb when hovered.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

Alpha.description:
Description: Sets the transparency of each range in the color range.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

PlotPriceAs.description:
Description: This attribute lets you configure how your price chart would be plotted as. You can use either of the three options - CANDLESTICK, BAR or LINE
      Type: String
      Range: CANDLESTICK, LINE OR BAR

PlotClosingPrice.description:
Description: If you have opted to plot the price chart as line, this attribute lets you configure whether the closing price will be used for plot or opening price.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowVolumeChart.description:
Description: If you want to hide volume chart, you can use this attribute.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

VolumeHeightPercent.description:
Description: Height of the volume chart in percent (with respect to total chart). By default, it's set to 40%.
      Type: Number
      Range: 20%-80%

PYAxisName.description:
Description: The y-axis name for the price chart.
      Type: String

VYAxisName.description:
Description: The y-axis name for the volume chart.
      Type: String

XAxisMinValue.description:
Description: The candlestick chart has both x and y axis as numeric. This attribute lets you explicitly set the x-axis lower limit. If you do not specify this value, the chart will automatically calculate the best value for you.
      Type: Number
      Range: Numeric Value

XAxisMaxValue.description:
Description: The candlestick chart has both x and y axis as numeric. This attribute lets you explicitly set the x-axis upper limit. If you do not specify this value, the chart will automatically calculate the best value for you.
      Type: Number
      Range: Numeric Value

PYAxisMaxValue.description:
Description: This attribute helps you explicitly set the upper limit of the price chart. If you don't specify this value, it is automatically calculated by the chart based on the data provided by you.
      Type: Number

PYAxisMinValue.description:
Description: This attribute helps you explicitly set the lower limit of the price chart. If you don't specify this value, it is automatically calculated by the chart based on the data provided by you.
      Type: Number

VYAxisMinValue.description:
Description: Lower limit for the volume chart axis. If you do not specify this, the chart will automatically calculate for you.
      Type: Number

VYAxisMaxValue.description:
Description: Upper limit for the volume chart axis. If you do not specify this, the chart will automatically calculate for you.
      Type: Number

ForceVYAxisValueDecimals.description:
Description: Whether to forcefully attach decimal places to all y-axis values of the volume chart. For example, If you limit the maximum number of decimal digits to 2, a number like 55.345 will be rounded to 55.34. This does not mean that all y-axis numbers will be displayed with a fixed number of decimal places. For instance 55 will not be displayed as 55.00 and 55.1 will not become 55.10. In order to have fixed number of decimal places attached to all y-axis numbers, set this attribute to 1.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

VYAxisValueDecimals.description:
Description: If you have opted to not adjust div lines of the volume chart, you can specify the div line values decimal precision using this attribute.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0-10

PYAxisNameFont.description:
Description: Sets the primary y-axis font family for the text, in case of a dual-y axis chart
      Type: String
      Range: Font Name

PYAxisNameFontColor.description:
Description: Sets the primary y-axis font color
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

PYAxisNameFontSize.description:
Description: Specifies the primary y-axis font size
      Type: Number
      Range: 6 - 72

PYAxisNameFontBold.description:
Description: Whether primary y-axis font should be bold
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

PYAxisNameFontItalic.description:
Description: Whether primary y-axis font should be italicized
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

PYAxisNameBgColor.description:
Description: Sets the background color for primary y-axis text
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

PYAxisNameBorderColor.description:
Description: Sets the border around the primary y-axis text
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

PYAxisNameAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the primary y-axis alpha including font and background
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

PYAxisNameFontAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the primary y-axis font alpha
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

PYAxisNameBgAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the primary y-axis background alpha
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

PYAxisNameBorderAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the primary y-axis border alpha
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

PYAxisNameBorderPadding.description:
Description: Sets the primary y-axis border padding
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

PYAxisNameBorderRadius.description:
Description: Sets the primary y-axis border radius
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

PYAxisNameBorderThickness.description:
Description: Sets the primary y-axis border thickness
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

PYAxisNameBorderDashed.description:
Description: Whether the border around the primary y-axis name should be rendered using dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (border rendered using straight lines)
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

PYAxisNameBorderDashLen.description:
Description: Sets the length of each dash when the border around the primary y-axis name is rendered using dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

PYAxisNameBorderDashGap.description:
Description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashes when the border around the primary y-axis name is rendered using dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

VYAxisNameFont.description:
Description: Sets the font for the volume y-axis name.
      Type: String
      Range: Font Name

VYAxisNameFontColor.description:
Description: Sets the volume y-axis font color
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

VYAxisNameFontSize.description:
Description: Specifies the volume y-axis font size
      Type: Number
      Range: 6 - 72

VYAxisNameFontBold.description:
Description: Whether volume y-axis font should be bold
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

VYAxisNameFontItalic.description:
Description: Whether volume y-axis font should be italicized
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

VYAxisNameBgColor.description:
Description: Sets the background color for volume y-axis text
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

VYAxisNameBorderColor.description:
Description: Sets the border around the volume y-axis text
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

VYAxisNameAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the volume y-axis alpha including font and background
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

VYAxisNameFontAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the volume y-axis font alpha
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

VYAxisNameBgAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the volume y-axis background alpha
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

VYAxisNameBorderAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the volume y-axis border alpha
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

VYAxisNameBorderPadding.description:
Description: Sets the volume y-axis border padding
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

VYAxisNameBorderRadius.description:
Description: Sets the volume y-axis border radius
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

VYAxisNameBorderThickness.description:
Description: Sets the volume y-axis border thickness
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

VYAxisNameBorderDashed.description:
Description: Whether the border around the volume y-axis name should be rendered using dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (border rendered using straight lines)
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

VYAxisNameBorderDashLen.description:
Description: Sets the length of each dash when the border around the volume y-axis name is rendered using dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

VYAxisNameBorderDashGap.description:
Description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashes when the border around the volume y-axis name is rendered using dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

BearBorderColor.description:
Description: Border color for the bear candles/lines/bars.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

BearFillColor.description:
Description: Fill color for the bear candles/lines/bars.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

BullBorderColor.description:
Description: Border color for the bull candles/lines/bars.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

BullFillColor.description:
Description: Fill color for the bull candles/lines/bars.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

RollOverBandColor.description:
Description: When you hover your mouse over any candle on the chart, you'll see a colored band moving with your mouse. This attribute lets you set the color of that band.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

RollOverBandAlpha.description:
Description: Lets you set the alpha of the color band.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

ShowVPlotBorder.description:
Description: Whether to show plot border for the volume chart.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

VPlotBorderColor.description:
Description: Border color for the volume chart bars.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

VPlotBorderThickness.description:
Description: Thickness of border of the volume chart bars.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

VPlotBorderAlpha.description:
Description: Alpha of border of the volume chart bars.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

PlotLineThickness.description:
Description: Thickness of the lines on the chart, if you're plotting the price chart as lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

PlotLineAlpha.description:
Description: Alpha of the lines on the chart.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

PlotLineDashLen.description:
Description: Sets the length of each dash when plot lines are rendered as dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

PlotLineDashGap.description:
Description: Sets the gap between consecutive dashes when plot lines are rendered as dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

NumPDivLines.description:
Description: Number of divisional lines to be plotted on the price chart.
      Type: Number

ForceVDecimals.description:
Description: Whether to add 0 padding at the end of decimal numbers of the volume chart. For example, if you set decimals as 2 and a number is 23.4. If `forceDecimals` is set to 1, the number will automatically be converted to 23.40 (note the extra 0 at the end).
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

VFormatNumberScale.description:
Description: Configuration whether to add K (thousands) and M (millions) to a number belonging to volume chart after truncating and rounding it - e.g., if `vFormatNumberScale` is set to 1, 10434 would become 1.04K (with `vDecimals` set to 2 places). Same with numbers in millions - an M will be added at the end.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

VDefaultNumberScale.description:
Description: The default unit of the numbers belonging to volume chart.
      Type: String

VNumberScaleUnit.description:
Description: Unit of each block of the scale of volume chart.
      Type: String

VNumberScaleValue.description:
Description: Range of the various blocks that constitute the scale for volume chart.
      Type: String

VMaxScaleRecursion.description:
Description: How many recursions to complete during recursive scaling of the numbers of volume chart? -1 completes the entire set of recursion.
      Type: Number

VNumberPrefix.description:
Description: Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers belonging to volume chart.
      Type: String
      Range: Character

VNumberSuffix.description:
Description: Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers belonging to volume chart.
      Type: String
      Range: Character

VDecimals.description:
Description: Number of decimal places to which all numbers belonging to volume chart would be rounded to.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0-10

VerticalLineAlpha.description:
Description: Lets you set the alpha for category lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

VerticalLineColor.description:
Description: You can opt to show vertical lines for each category label. This attribute lets you set the color for all of them.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

VerticalLineDashed.description:
Description: Whether the vertical lines should be rendered as dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (trendline rendered using straight lines)
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

VerticalLineDashLen.description:
Description: Sets the length of each dash when vertical lines are rendered as dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

VerticalLineDashGap.description:
Description: Sets the gap between consecutive dashes when vertical lines are rendered as dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

VerticalLineThickness.description:
Description: Lets you set the thickness for category lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

LineDashed.description:
Description: Whether the vertical lines should be rendered as dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (vertical lines using straight lines)
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowVerticalLine.description:
Description: Whether the vertical line should be shown for this category.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

X.description:
Description: The candle stick chart has both x and y axis as numeric. This attribute lets you define the x value (numerical position on the x-axis) where this category name would be placed.
      Type: Number
      Range: Numeric Value

Open.description:
Description: Opening price for the set.
      Type: Number

Close.description:
Description: Closing price for the set.
      Type: Number

High.description:
Description: Highest price point reached for the set.
      Type: Number

Low.description:
Description: Lowest price point reached for the set.
      Type: Number

Volume.description:
Description: Volume of transaction. If you do not specify volume for any of the sets, PowerCharts XT wouldn't plot the volume chart at the bottom.
      Type: Number

Bordercolor.description:
Description: If you need to highlight a particular candlestick, you can assign a border color to that particular set using this attribute.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

TrendSetColor.description:
Description: Lets you set the color for all the trend-sets on the chart.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

TrendSetAlpha.description:
Description: Lets you set the alpha for all the trend-sets on the chart.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

TrendSetThickness.description:
Description: Helps you set the thickness for all the trend-set lines on the chart.
      Type: Number

TrendSetDashed.description:
Description: Whether the trendset should be rendered as dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (trendline rendered using straight lines)
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

TrendSetDashLen.description:
Description: Sets the length of each dash when trendset is rendered as dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

TrendSetDashGap.description:
Description: Sets the gap between consecutive dashes when trendset is rendered as dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

Dashlen.description:
Description: Sets the length of each dash when trendset is rendered as dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

Dashgap.description:
Description: Sets the gap between consecutive dashes when trendset is rendered as dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

Includeinlegend.description:
Description: Whether to include the name of this trend set in legend.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

PlotBinSize.description:
Description: This attribute is used to skip the data plot without any change in visualization. When set to `1`, minimum one data plot will be rendered within the width of one pixel. 

 Example, if `plotBinSize: 1`, minimum one column plot will be rendered within the width of one pixel. For line and area charts, minimum of two anchors connecting one single line will be drawn. If `plotBinSize: 0.5`, minimum two column plot will be rendered within the width of one pixel. Data skipping can be disabled by setting this attribute to `0`. 

 Default value: __0.5__
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

LabelBinSize.description:
Description: This attribute is used to skip the labels of the data plots. When set to `1`, minimum one label will be displayed within the width of one pixel. To disable this label skipping, set this attribute to `0`. 

Default value: __1__
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

XAxisLineThickness.description:
Description: Sets the thickness of the x-axis line of the chart.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

PlotGradientColor.description:
Description: You can globally add a gradient color to the entire plot of chart by specifying the second color as this attribute. For example, if you've specified individual colors for your columns and now you want a gradient that ends in white. You need to specify FFFFFF (white) as this color and the chart will now draw plots as gradient.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

UsePlotGradientColor.description:
Description: Gradient color is a color added globally to the entire plot of chart by specifying the second color in an attribute. This attribute sets the gradient color to _true_. 

__Default value__: 0
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

DrawCrossLine.description:
Description: This attribute sets a cross line (vertical line/area), when you hover a data plot. 

Default value: __0__
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

CrossLineAnimation.description:
Description: This attributes enables the animation for the cross line. 

Default value: __0__
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

CrossLineAnimationDuration.description:
Description: This attribute sets the animation duration of the cross line. 

Default value: __0.09 seconds__
      Type: Number
      Range: In seconds

PlotColorinTooltip.description:
Description: This attribute displays the color of each plot with their labels in tooltip. 

Default value: __0__
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

PlotHoverGradientColor.description:
Description: Specifies the gradient color for the data plots when hovered. For example, if you've specified individual colors and now you want hover color that ends in white, You need to specify it.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

PlotHoverRatio.description:
Description: Helps you specify the ratio of gradient colors when hovered.
      Type: Number

PlotHoverAngle.description:
Description: This attribute specifies the angle of the gradient color when hovered.
      Type: Number

PlotBorderHoverDashed.description:
Description: When a data plot is hovered, this attribute is used to specify whether the data plot border will be rendered as a dashed line. 

__Default value__: 0 (border rendered using straight lines)
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

PlotBorderHoverDashLen.description:
Description: When a data plot is hovered, this attribute is used to set the length of each dash if the border around the data plots are rendered using dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

PlotBorderHoverDashGap.description:
Description: When a data plot is hovered, this attribute is used to set the gap between consecutive dashes if the border around the data plots are rendered using dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

HoverGradientColor.description:
Description: This attribute sets the gradient color of the data plot on hover.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

HoverRatio.description:
Description: This attribute sets the ratio of gradient colors when hovered.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

HoverAngle.description:
Description: This attribute specifies the angle of the gradient color when hovered.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 360

BorderHoverDashed.description:
Description: When a data plot is hovered, this attribute is used to specify whether a data plot border will be rendered as a dashed line. 

__Default value__: 0 (border rendered using straight lines)
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

BorderHoverDashLen.description:
Description: When a data plot is hovered, this attribute is used to set the length of each dash if the border around a data plot is rendered using dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

BorderHoverDashGap.description:
Description: When a data plot is hovered, this attribute is used to set the gap between consecutive dashes if the border around a data plot is rendered using dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

MaxLabelHeight.description:
Description: This attribute can be used to set the maximum height for the x-axis labels (data labels) excluding the x-axis title. If any label goes beyond this height, the label will be truncated. In stagger mode, the number of stagger lines will be reduced if they exceed this value.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

LabelDisplay.description:
Description: Using this attribute, you can customize the alignment of data labels (x-axis labels). There are 5 options: AUTO, WRAP, STAGGER, ROTATE or NONE. By default, this attribute is set to AUTO mode which means that the alignment of the data labels is determined automatically depending on the size of the chart. WRAP wraps the label text if it is too long to fit in one line. ROTATE rotates the labels vertically. STAGGER divides the labels into multiple lines.
      Type: String
      Range: 'AUTO', 'WRAP', 'STAGGER', 'ROTATE', 'NONE'

RotateLabels.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set whether the data labels will show up as rotated labels on the chart.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

SlantLabels.description:
Description: If you've opted to show rotated labels on chart, this attribute lets you set the configuration whether the labels will show as slanted labels or fully vertical ones.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

LabelStep.description:
Description: By default, all the labels are displayed on the chart. However, if you've a set of streaming data (like name of months or days of week), you can opt to show every n-th label for better clarity. This attribute just lets you do so. When a value greater than 1 (n) is set to this attribute, the first label from left and every label at the n-th position from left will be displayed. e.g., a chart showing data for 12 months and set with `labelStep: 3` will show labels for January, April, July, and October. The rest of the labels will be skipped.
      Type: Number
      Range: 1 or above

StaggerLines.description:
Description: If you've opted for STAGGER mode as `labelDisplay`, using this attribute you can control how many lines to stagger the label to. By default, all labels are displayed in a single line.
      Type: Number
      Range: 2 or above

RotateValues.description:
Description: If you've opted to show data values, you can rotate them using this attribute.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowDivLineValues.description:
Description: Whether to show div line values. If not specified `showYAxisValues` attribute overrides this value.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

AdjustDiv.description:
Description: FusionCharts XT automatically tries to adjust divisional lines and limit values based on the data provided. However, if you want to set your explicit lower and upper limit values and number of divisional lines, first set this attribute to false. That will disable automatic adjustment of divisional lines.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

XAxisName.description:
Description: X-axis title of the chart.
      Type: String

YAxisName.description:
Description: Y-axis title of the chart.
      Type: String

ShowYAxisValues.description:
Description: FusionCharts XT y-axis is divided into vertical sections using div (divisional) lines. Each div line assumes a value based on its position. Using this attribute you can set whether to show those div line (y-axis) values or not. This attribute shows or hides the y-axis divisional lines and limits. The values of `showLimits` and `showDivLineValues`, if specified explicitly, overrides the value of this attribute.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

YAxisValuesStep.description:
Description: By default, all div lines show their values. However, you can opt to display every x(th) div line value using this attribute.
      Type: Number
      Range: 1 or above

RotateYAxisName.description:
Description: If you do not wish to rotate y-axis name, set this as 0. It specifically comes to use when you've the special characters (UTF-8) in your y-axis name that do not show up in rotated mode.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

YAxisNameWidth.description:
Description: If you opt to not rotate y-axis name, you can choose a maximum width that will be applied to y-axis name.
      Type: Number
      Range: (In Pixels)

YAxisMinValue.description:
Description: This attribute helps you explicitly set the lower limit of the chart. If you don't specify this value, it is automatically calculated by FusionCharts XT based on the data provided by you.
      Type: Number
      Range: Numeric Value

YAxisMaxValue.description:
Description: This attribute helps you explicitly set the upper limit of the chart. If you don't specify this value, it is automatically calculated by FusionCharts XT based on the data provided by you.
      Type: Number
      Range: Numeric Value

ForceYAxisValueDecimals.description:
Description: Whether to forcefully attach decimal places to all y-axis values. For example, If you limit the maximum number of decimal digits to 2, a number like 55.345 will be rounded to 55.34. This does not mean that all y-axis numbers will be displayed with a fixed number of decimal places. For instance 55 will not be displayed as 55.00 and 55.1 will not become 55.10. In order to have fixed number of decimal places attached to all y-axis numbers, set this attribute to 1.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

YAxisValueDecimals.description:
Description: If you've opted to not adjust div lines, you can specify the div line values decimal precision using this attribute.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0-10

XAxisNameFontColor.description:
Description: Sets the x-axis font color
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

XAxisNameFontSize.description:
Description: Specifies the x-axis font size
      Type: Number
      Range: 6 - 72

XAxisNameFontBold.description:
Description: Whether x-axis font should be bold
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

XAxisNameFontItalic.description:
Description: Whether x-axis font should be italicized
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

XAxisNameBgColor.description:
Description: Sets the background color for x-axis text
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

XAxisNameBorderColor.description:
Description: Sets the border around the x-axis text
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

XAxisNameAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the x-axis alpha including font and background
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

XAxisNameFontAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the x-axis font alpha
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

XAxisNameBgAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the x-axis background alpha
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

XAxisNameBorderAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the x-axis border alpha
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

XAxisNameBorderPadding.description:
Description: Sets the x-axis border padding
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

XAxisNameBorderRadius.description:
Description: Sets the x-axis border radius
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

XAxisNameBorderThickness.description:
Description: Sets the x-axis border thickness
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

XAxisNameBorderDashed.description:
Description: Whether the border around the x-axis name should be rendered using dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (border rendered using straight lines)
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

XAxisNameBorderDashLen.description:
Description: Sets the length of each dash when the border around the x-axis name is rendered using dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

XAxisNameBorderDashGap.description:
Description: Sets the gap between consecutive dashes when the border around the x-axis name is rendered using dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

YAxisNameFont.description:
Description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) font family for the text
      Type: String
      Range: Font Name

YAxisNameFontColor.description:
Description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) font color
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

YAxisNameFontSize.description:
Description: Specifies the y-axis (primary / secondary) font size
      Type: Number
      Range: 6 - 72

YAxisNameFontBold.description:
Description: Whether y-axis (primary / secondary) font should be bold
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

YAxisNameFontItalic.description:
Description: Whether y-axis (primary / secondary) font should be italicized
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

YAxisNameBgColor.description:
Description: Sets the background color for y-axis (primary / secondary) text
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

YAxisNameBorderColor.description:
Description: Sets the border around the y-axis (primary / secondary) text
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

YAxisNameAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) alpha including font and background
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

YAxisNameFontAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) font alpha
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

YAxisNameBgAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) background alpha
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

YAxisNameBorderAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) border alpha
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

YAxisNameBorderPadding.description:
Description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) border padding
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

YAxisNameBorderRadius.description:
Description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) border radius
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

YAxisNameBorderThickness.description:
Description: Sets the y-axis (primary / secondary) border thickness
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

YAxisNameBorderDashed.description:
Description: Whether the border around the y-axis name should be rendered using dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (border rendered using straight lines)
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

YAxisNameBorderDashLen.description:
Description: Sets the length of each dash when the border around the y-axis name is rendered using dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

YAxisNameBorderDashGap.description:
Description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashes when the border around the y-axis name is rendered using dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

CanvasBaseColor.description:
Description: Helps you specify the color for canvas base.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

ShowCanvasBg.description:
Description: Whether to show canvas background.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowCanvasBase.description:
Description: Whether to show canvas base.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

CanvasBaseDepth.description:
Description: Height of canvas base (in pixels)
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

CanvasBgDepth.description:
Description: Depth of Canvas Background
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

OverlapColumns.description:
Description: Whether to overlap columns over each other to give a richer 3D look. If there are too many columns on the chart, it will automatically overlap.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

NumDivLines.description:
Description: Number of horizontal axis division lines that you want on the chart.
      Type: Number
      Range: Numeric value > 0

DivLineColor.description:
Description: Color for divisional lines.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

DivLineThickness.description:
Description: Thickness of divisional lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: 1-5

DivLineAlpha.description:
Description: Alpha of divisional lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

DivLineDashed.description:
Description: Whether the divisional lines should be rendered as dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (divisional lines rendered using straight lines)
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

DivLineDashLen.description:
Description: Sets the length of each dash when divisional lines are rendered as dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

DivLineDashGap.description:
Description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashes when divisional lines are rendered as dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

ZeroPlaneColor.description:
Description: Color for the Zero Plane. Zero Plane is the line/plane that appears at position 0 on the y-axis, when negative data is being shown on the chart.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

ZeroPlaneAlpha.description:
Description: Alpha of zero plane.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

ZeroPlaneThickness.description:
Description: Thickness of zero plane.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

ZeroPlaneShowBorder.description:
Description: Whether to show border of zero plane.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ZeroPlaneBorderColor.description:
Description: Sets the border color of zero plane.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

ShowZeroPlaneValue.description:
Description: Allows you to show or hide the value on which the zero plane exists on the y-axis. By default, the value is displayed.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

XAxisNamePadding.description:
Description: Using this, you can set the distance between the top end of x-axis title and the bottom end of data labels (or canvas, if data labels are not to be shown).
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

YAxisNamePadding.description:
Description: Using this, you can set the distance between the right end of y-axis title and the start of y-axis values (or canvas, if the y-axis values are not to be shown).
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

YAxisValuesPadding.description:
Description: This attribute helps you set the horizontal space between the canvas left edge and the y-axis values or trend line values (on left/right side). This is particularly useful, when you want more space between your canvas and y-axis values.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

LabelPadding.description:
Description: This attribute sets the vertical space between the labels and canvas bottom edge. If you want more space between the canvas and the x-axis labels, you can use this attribute to control it.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

VLine.description:
Description: Set this attribute to __true__ to render a vertical data separator line.
      Type: String

ShowLabelBorder.description:
Description: Whether to show a border around the vLine label.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

LinePosition.description:
Description: Helps configure the position of vertical line i.e., if a vLine is to be plotted between 2 points Jan and Feb, user can set any position between 0 and 1 to indicate the relative position of vLine between these two points (0 means Jan and 1 means Feb). By default, its 0.5 to show in between the points.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0-1

LabelPosition.description:
Description: Helps configure the position of the vLine label by setting a relative position between 0 and 1. In vertical charts, 0 means top of canvas and 1 means bottom. In horizontal charts, 0 means left of canvas and 1 means right.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0-1

LabelHAlign.description:
Description: Horizontal anchor point for the alignment of vLine label.
      Type: String
      Range: left, center, right

LabelVAlign.description:
Description: Vertical anchor point for the alignment of vLine label.
      Type: String
      Range: top, middle, bottom

ValueOnRight.description:
Description: Whether to show the trend line value on left side or right side of chart. This is particularly useful when the trend line display values on the chart are colliding with divisional lines values on the chart.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

TrendValueFont.description:
Description: Sets the font family for the trend-line display value.
      Type: String
      Range: Font Name

TrendValueFontSize.description:
Description: Sets the font size for the trend-line display value.
      Type: Number
      Range:

TrendValueFontBold.description:
Description: Sets whether the trend-line display value will be bold formatted. 

Default value: 0 (not bold formatted)
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

TrendValueFontItalic.description:
Description: Sets whether the trend-line display value will be italicized. 

Default value: 0 (not italicized)
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

TrendValueBgColor.description:
Description: Sets the background color for the trend-line display value.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

TrendValueBorderColor.description:
Description: Sets the border color for the trend-line display value.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

TrendValueAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the transparency for the trend-line display value. 

Default value: 100
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

TrendValueBgAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the transparency for the background of the trend-line display value. 

Default value: 100
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

TrendValueBorderAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the transparency for the border around the trend-line display value. 

Default value: 100
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

TrendValueBorderPadding.description:
Description: Sets padding for the border around the trend-line display value. 
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

TrendValueBorderRadius.description:
Description: Sets the radius for the border around the trend-line display value. 
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

TrendValueBorderThickness.description:
Description: Sets the thickness for the border around the trend-line display value. 
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

TrendValueBorderDashed.description:
Description: Whether the border around the trend-line display value should be rendered as dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (border rendered using straight lines)
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

TrendValueBorderDashLen.description:
Description: Sets the length of each dash when the border around the trend-line display value is rendered as dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

TrendValueBorderDashGap.description:
Description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashes when the border around the trend-line display value is rendered as dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

Animate3D.description:
Description: This attribute enables you to set whether the initial animation of the 3D elements in chart canvas will occur or not. If set to 0, it will also set off chart canvas' rotation while using JavaScript API functions like `view2D(), resetView(), rotateView(). `The view will be updated instantly without any rotation or animation.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ExeTime.description:
Description: It sets the time in seconds (can accept decimals) that the 3D elements of the chart take to animate when the chart is rendered initially. This attribute also sets the time that the chart canvas will take to animate when the chart is transformed to any view (View3D, View 2D, Reset View) using context menu (right click menu). This is also applicable while using JavaScript API functions - `view2D(), view3D, resetView() or rotateView()`. Default value is 0.5.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0.00 - 10.00

AreaOverColumns.description:
Description: If you've both area and column plots on the combination chart, this attribute lets you configure whether area chart will appear over column chart.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

DivLineEffect.description:
Description: This attribute enables you to apply an effect, for example, EMBOSS, or BEVEL to the divisional lines as well as to the trendlines.
      Type: String
      Range: EMBOSS or BEVEL or NONE

ZeroPlaneMesh.description:
Description: Whether to draw the zero plane as a wireframe mesh or as a filled plane. If set to 1, a mesh on the zero plane of the chart will be drawn.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

YLabelGap.description:
Description: This attribute helps you set the horizontal space between the canvas wall edge and the y-axis values or trend line values (on left/right side). This is particularly useful, when you want more space between your canvas and y-axis values.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

XLabelGap.description:
Description: This attribute sets the vertical space between the labels and canvas wall edge. If you want more space between the canvas and the x-axis labels, you can use this attribute to control it.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

RenderAs.description:
Description: This attribute defines what the particular dataset will be plotted as. Valid values are COLUMN, AREA or LINE.
      Type: String
      Range: COLUMN, AREA or LINE

Use3DLighting.description:
Description: Whether to use advanced gradients and shadow effects to create better looking 3D cylinder?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

SetAdaptiveMin.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set whether the lower limit will be 0 (in case of all positive values on chart) or should the lower limit adapt itself to a different figure based on values provided to the chart.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

LowerLimitDisplay.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to display a label instead of the lower limit. For example, in a chart displaying Literacy Rate on a scale of 0 - 100%, you may need to show the label Low at the starting point of the chart. Upon using this attribute to specify the label, the value 0 will be replaced by Low. Default value: If you do not specify the `lowerLimitDisplay` attribute, the lower limit value will be shown.
      Type: String

UpperLimitDisplay.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to display a label instead of the upper limit. Upon using this attribute, the upper limit of the chart gets replaced by the label specified. Default value: If you do not specify the `upperLimitDisplay` attribute, the upper limit value will be shown.
      Type: String

ShowTickMarks.description:
Description: Whether to show tick marks?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowTickValues.description:
Description: Whether to show tick values?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowLimits.description:
Description: Whether to show the first and last tick value (i.e., chart lower and upper limit)?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

AdjustTM.description:
Description: Whether to adjust major tick mark number so as to best distribute the specified chart scale.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

TicksOnRight.description:
Description: Whether to show ticks on the left or right side of gauge? By default, this attribute is turned on.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

MajorTMNumber.description:
Description: Number of major tick marks.
      Type: Number

MajorTMColor.description:
Description: Major tick marks color.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

MajorTMAlpha.description:
Description: Major tick marks alpha.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

MajorTMHeight.description:
Description: Width of major tick marks.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

MajorTMThickness.description:
Description: Thickness of major tick mark line.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

MinorTMNumber.description:
Description: Number of minor tick marks. Minor tick marks refer to the tick marks between two major tick marks.
      Type: Number

MinorTMColor.description:
Description: Color of minor tick marks.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

MinorTMAlpha.description:
Description: Alpha of minor tick marks.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

MinorTMHeight.description:
Description: Width of minor tick marks.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

MinorTMThickness.description:
Description: Thickness of minor tick marks.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

TickMarkDistance.description:
Description: Distance between the gauge and tick marks.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

TickValueDistance.description:
Description: Distance between tick values and tick marks.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

TickValueStep.description:
Description: If you need to show every n-th tick value only, you can specify that value here. The upper and lower limit of the scale is always displayed.
      Type: Number

TickValueDecimals.description:
Description: Number of decimals to which tick values will be rounded to.
      Type: Number

ForceTickValueDecimals.description:
Description: Whether to force number of decimals on tick values?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

CylOriginX.description:
Description: Origin x co-ordinate for cylinder.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

CylOriginY.description:
Description: Origin y co-ordinate for cylinder.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

CylRadius.description:
Description: Radius for the cylinder.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

CylHeight.description:
Description: If you want to manually specify the height for cylinder, please use this attribute.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

CylYScale.description:
Description: Y-scale perspective for cylinder.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0-50

CylFillColor.description:
Description: Color of cylinder fill.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

CylGlassColor.description:
Description: Sets the color of cylinders glass.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

CylFillHoverColor.description:
Description: This attribute sets the color of the cylinder when hovered.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex color code

CylFillHoverAlpha.description:
Description: This attribute sets the transparency of the cylinder when hovered.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

AnimateClockwise.description:
Description: Animates the plot in clockwise direction. 

Default value: 0
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

AlphaAnimation.description:
Description: Instead of rotational animation, you can set alpha animation which displays your chart slowly from `0` alpha to `100`. 

Default value : 0
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowZeroPies.description:
Description: Configuration whether to show pies with 0 values (and their values). Otherwise, they won't show up in the chart.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

UseDataPlotColorForLabels.description:
Description: Uses the same data plot color for data labels.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowVLineLabelBorder.description:
Description: If you've opted to show a label for any of your vLines in the chart, you can collectively configure whether to show border for all such labels using this attribute. If you want to show label border for just a particular vLine, you can over-ride this value by specifying border configuration for that specific vLine.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

RotateVLineLabels.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set whether the vline labels will show up as rotated labels on the chart. 

Default value: 0
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

DoughnutRadius.description:
