Description: This attribute lets you explicitly set the inner radius of the chart. FusionCharts XT automatically calculates the best fit radius for the chart. This attribute is useful if you want to enforce one of your own values.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

StartingAngle.description:
Description: By default, the doughnut chart starts from angle 0 degree i.e., the first doughnut slice starts plotting from 0 degree angle. If you want to change the starting angle of the chart, use this attribute. It obeys the conventions of co-ordinate geometry where 0 degrees means hand of a clock at 3. Starting angle Increases anti-clockwise.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0-360

Radius3D.description:
Description: You can define the 3D Radius of chart in percentage using this attribute. It basically helps you set the bevel distance for the pie/doughnut (if in 3D Lighting Mode).
      Type: Number
      Range: 0-100

EnableSlicing.description:
Description: This attribute specifies whether slicing of the data plots should be enabled for pie/doughnut charts. Setting this attribute to `1` will enable slicing for the chart, setting it to `0` will disable slicing. 

 Default value: 1
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

SlicingDistance.description:
Description: If you've opted to slice a particular pie/doughnut slice, using this attribute you can control the distance between the slice and the center of chart.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

EnableRotation.description:
Description: The doughnut charts have three modes: Slicing, Rotation, and Link. By default, a chart starts in Slicing mode. If you need to enable rotation from XML, set this attribute to 1. But, when links are defined, the chart always works in Link mode irrespective of the value of this attribute.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

EnableMultiSlicing.description:
Description: This attribute specifes whether single-slicing for the data plots should be enabled for pie/doughnut charts. Setting this attribute to `0` will enable single-slicing for the chart, setting it to `1` will enable multi-slicing. 

 Default value: 1
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

SkipOverlapLabels.description:
Description: Whether to skip labels that are overlapping even when using smart labels. If not, they might overlap if there are too many labels.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

IsSmartLineSlanted.description:
Description: The smart lines (smart label connector lines) can appear in two ways: Slanted or Straight. This attribute lets you choose between them.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ManageLabelOverflow.description:
Description: This attribute tries to manage overflow of data labels. If enabled, data labels are either wrapped or truncated with ellipses to prevent them from overflowing out of the chart canvas. In case `smartLabels` is disabled, the labels are wrapped to avoid the overflow. Since `smartLabels` is disabled, the wrapped labels might get overlapped. When `smartLabels` is enabled, management of the overflowing labels fit in the "quadrant specific smart labeling algorithm". Data labels try to wrap first. In case, there is a space constraint in the quadrant, the labels get truncated with ellipses.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

Centerlabel.description:
Description: This attribute sets the label at the center if we hover the cursor over the chart. It will display the value for that particular area which has been hovered.
      Type: String

CenterLabelFont.description:
Description: Sets the center label font family for the text.
      Type: String
      Range: Font name

CenterLabelFontSize.description:
Description: Specifies the label label font size.
      Type: Number
      Range: 6 - 72

CenterLabelColor.description:
Description: Sets the center label font color.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex color code

CenterLabelAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the transparency of the center label.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

CenterLabelBold.description:
Description: Sets whether the center label value will be bold formatted. 

__Default value__: 1
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

CenterLabelItalic.description:
Description: This attribute sets whether center label font should be italicized or not. 

__Default value__: 0
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

CenterLabelBgColor.description:
Description: Sets the background color for center label text.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex color code

CenterLabelBgAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the background transparency of the center label.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

CenterLabelBorderColor.description:
Description: Sets the color of the border around the center label text.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex color code

CenterLabelBorderAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the transparency of the border around the center label text.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

CenterLabelBorderThickness.description:
Description: Sets the center label border thickness.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

CenterLabelBorderRadius.description:
Description: Sets the center label border radius.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

CenterLabelTextPadding.description:
Description: Sets the center label text padding.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

CenterLabelPadding.description:
Description: Sets the center label padding.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

CenterLabelBgOval.description:
Description: Sets the background of the center label in oval shape. 

__Default value__: 0
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowCenterLabelShadow.description:
Description: Whether to apply the shadow effect for the center label. 

__Default value__: 0
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

CenterLabelHoverColor.description:
Description: This attribute can set the hover color for the center label text.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex color code

CenterLabelHoverAlpha.description:
Description: This attribute sets the transparency for the center label text when hovered.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

CenterLabelToolText.description:
Description: You can define the tooltip for a center label using this attribute.
      Type: String

Defaultcenterlabel.description:
Description: Sets the default label for the chart. This label can be seen at the center of the chart.
      Type: String

ShowLabel.description:
Description: You can individually opt to show/hide labels of individual data items using this attribute.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

HoverColor.description:
Description: This attribute can set the hover color for a particular data plot.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

HoverAlpha.description:
Description: This attribute sets the transparency for a particular data plot when hovered.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

BorderHoverColor.description:
Description: This attribute sets the border color of the data plot on hover.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

BorderHoverAlpha.description:
Description: This attribute sets the border's transparency for the data plot on hover.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

BorderHoverThickness.description:
Description: This attribute sets the thickness for the data plot's border on hover.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

EnableLink.description:
Description: In a drag chart, if you have links defined for your data points (anchors), by default the links would NOT be activated. The user would need to activate it by right clicking on chart and then selecting "Enable Links" options. However, if you wish to enable links (instead of dragging functionality) by default, you can set this attribute to 1. In that case, the links would be accessible by default and the user can switch between link and dragging mode using the context menu of the chart.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

AllowAxisChange.description:
Description: In drag charts of PowerCharts, the end user has an option to change axis limits. He can increase or decrease the axis limits as per his requirements. If you do not want the user to be able to change axis limits, set this attribute as 0.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

SnapToDivOnly.description:
Description: Using this option, you can set the configuration that data points can be dragged only to the nearest divisional lines on chart. That means, the data points cannot acquire a value between any two divisional lines and as such, they will always fall on a divisional line value.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

SnapToDiv.description:
Description: When dragging the lines, you can snap them to the nearest divisional line on chart. To do so, just set this attribute as 1. The difference between this attribute and `snapToDivOnly` attribute is that `snapToDivOnly` attribute (when set to 1) allows you to drag the data points onto a div line. But using this attribute, you can create a "sticky" kind of interface, so that when the data points is dropped near a divisional line, it assumes the divisional line value. However, if it's dropped at a farther location, it will stay here.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

SnapToDivRelaxation.description:
Description: When snaptoDiv is set to 1, this attribute lets you set the distance in pixels (from each divisional lines), where the data points will behave "sticky".
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

DoNotSnap.description:
Description: If you do not want the data points to stick to any divisional lines, set this attribute as 1.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

AllowNegativeDrag.description:
Description: If you have positive as well as negative numbers on your chart, this attribute lets you configure whether the positive data points can be made negative by dragging them below zero plane.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ViewMode.description:
Description: Whether to set the chart in view mode or edit mode. In view mode, end users will only be able to drag the nodes (which are marked as drag-able). In edit mode, they can add/delete nodes or add/delete connectors.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowRestoreBtn.description:
Description: Sets whether the __Restore__ button, rendered in the bottom left corner of the drag-node chart, should be shown or hidden 

__Default value__: 1 (the button is shown)
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

EnableLinks.description:
Description: If there are any links defined on the nodes, you can opt to start the chart in link mode (rather than dragging mode) by setting this attribute as 1. Your users can, at runtime, toggle between link mode and drag mode using the right-click context menu of chart.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

EnableSubmit.description:
Description: If you want the user to be able to submit the data as form, you need to set this attribute to 1. If you are using JavaScript methods to get the data from chart, you can hide this option by setting this attribute to 0.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

FormAction.description:
Description: URL of your Server-side script to which you want to submit data. You can either use relative path or absolute path. The name of form variable which is to be requested in this page is `strXML`. If `submitFormUsingAjax` attribute is set to `1`, the `formAction` attribute will not work.
      Type: String
      Range:

FormMethod.description:
Description: Method of form submission - POST or GET. We recommend POST method if you're submitting data as XML.
      Type: String
      Range: GET or POST

FormTarget.description:
Description: Target of the form - _blank or _self. If `submitFormUsingAjax` attribute is set to `1`, the `formTarget` attribute will not work.
      Type: String
      Range:

SubmitText.description:
Description: Lets you configure the text for the submit option. By default, it is "Submit".
      Type: String
      Range:

SubmitFormUsingAjax.description:
Description: When the __Submit__ button in drag-able charts is clicked, instead of setting a new URL or a new tab for data values, this attribute (when set to `1`) updates the data in the existing page internally. 

 __Note__: If `submitFormUsingAjax` is set to `1`, the `formTarget` attribute will not work.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

EnableRestore.description:
Description: Whether to add the restore option in the menu.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

RestoreText.description:
Description: Lets you configure the text for the restore option. By default, it's "Restore"
      Type: String

Connectortooltext.description:
Description: This attribute works on text of the tooltip. It is used to specify the value or the text when we hover over the node or the connector. You can use variable values from the data level by putting a _$_ sign infront of it, eg $name, and you'll get the value of the name in the tooltip according to the chart.
      Type: String

PlotHoverHeight.description:
Description: This attribute sets the height of the rectangular plot when hovered over it.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

PlotHoverWidth.description:
Description: This attribute sets the width of the rectangular plot when hovered over it.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

PlotHoverRadius.description:
Description: This attribute sets the radius of the polygon/circle plot when hovered over it.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

AllowDrag.description:
Description: Whether to allow the end users to drag the nodes belonging to this data-set.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

HoverHeight.description:
Description: This attribute can set the height of a node when hovered.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

HoverWidth.description:
Description: This attribute can set the width of a node when hovered.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

HoverRadius.description:
Description: This attribute can set the radius of a node when hovered.
      Type: Number
      Range: I pixels

Shape.description:
Description: Lets you define the shape of node. Valid values are RECTANGLE / CIRCLE or POLYGON.
      Type: String
      Range: RECTANGLE / CIRCLE or POLYGON

Height.description:
Description: If you have selected Rectangle as the shape, this attribute lets you define the height of the same.
      Type: Number
      Range: Pixels

Width.description:
Description: If you have selected Rectangle as the shape, this attribute lets you define the width of the same.
      Type: Number
      Range: Pixels

NumSides.description:
Description: If you have selected Polygon as the shape for node, this attribute lets you define the sides for the same.
      Type: Number
      Range: More than 3.

ImageNode.description:
Description: Whether this node should contain an image. You can load GIF/JPG or PNG images in the chart.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ImageAlign.description:
Description: Vertical alignment of image in the node - TOP, MIDDLE or BOTTOM
      Type: String
      Range: TOP, MIDDLE or BOTTOM

ImageWidth.description:
Description: Width of the image that you intend to load.
      Type: Number
      Range: Pixels

ImageHeight.description:
Description: Height of the image that you intend to load.
      Type: Number
      Range: Pixels

LabelAlign.description:
Description: Vertical alignment of the node label in the node -TOP, MIDDLE or BOTTOM. This is applicable only when `imageNode='1'`.
      Type: String
      Range: TOP, MIDDLE or BOTTOM

Y.description:
Description: The y-axis value for the node. The node will be placed vertically on the y-axis based on this value. The y value (numerical position on the y-axis) is not based on pixels. All the values contribute to form a numeric scale on the y-axis. You can modify this scale using `yAxisMaxValue` and `yAxisMinValue` attributes.
      Type: Number
      Range: Numeric Value

ArrowAtEnd.description:
Description: Whether to show arrows at the end point of connectors.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ArrowAtStart.description:
Description: Whether to show arrows at the origin of connectors.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

StdThickness.description:
Description: Using this value, you can specify a number which will be multiplied by individual connectors strength to get the line thickness. Say, you have a connector whose thickness should be 2 pixels and another whose thickness should be 4. So, you can define this attribute as 2 and then specify the strength of first connector as 1 and second one as 2. This is useful when you're plotting network diagrams and you have to show link strength as connector thickness.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0-5

Strength.description:
Description: Default strength for all connectors.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0-2

From.description:
Description: ID of the node from where you want the connector to start. The id should refer to the user defined id of each node (defined in XML).
      Type: String
      Range:

To.description:
Description: ID of the node from where you want the connector to end. The id should refer to the user defined id of each node (defined in XML).
      Type: String
      Range:

Allowdrag.description:
Description: Whether to allow the user to drag this particular label.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

Fontsize.description:
Description: Sets the font size of the label.
      Type: Number
      Range:

Padding.description:
Description: Padding space around the text. The background color of the label spreads till this padding space. Around this padding space the border is drawn.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

Text.description:
Description: The text that is displayed on the label.
      Type: String
      Range:

HalfErrorBar.description:
Description: PowerCharts XT supports two types of error bars - normal error bars (half) and high-low error bars (full). Using this attribute, you can set whether to show half error bars or full error bars.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ErrorBarWidthPercent.description:
Description: What percent of column width should the width of error bars be.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Percent

ErrorInPercent.description:
Description: This attribute specifies that the error value is in percent of original plot value. 

__Default value__: 0
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ErrorBarColor.description:
Description: Color for all the error bars on the chart.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

ErrorBarAlpha.description:
Description: Alpha for all the error bars on the chart.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

ErrorBarThickness.description:
Description: Line thickness for all the error bars on the chart.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

Cumulativevalueonerrorbar.description:
Description: This attribute enables (or disables) cumulative plot values when the cursor is hovered upon the upper and lower limits of the error bars. Therefore, the tooltip will show the cumulative plot values along with the plot values. 

 Default value: __1__
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ErrorValue.description:
Description: Error value to be plotted as error bar on the chart.
      Type: Number

PositiveErrorValue.description:
Description: This attribute helps you explicitly set the error value for the upper (positive) limit. 

__Default value__: Inherited from `errorValue`
      Type: Number

NegativeErrorValue.description:
Description: This attribute helps you explicitly set the error value for the lower (negative) limit. 

__Default value__: Inherited from `errorValue`
      Type: Number

ErrorBarWidth.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set the width for the horizontal and vertical error bars.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

UseHorizontalErrorBar.description:
Description: Whether to show horizontal error bars in the chart.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

UseVerticalErrorBar.description:
Description: Whether to show vertical error bars in the chart. By default this attribute is set to 1.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

HalfHorizontalErrorBar.description:
Description: If you have opted to show horizontal error bars, this attribute lets you set whether the chart will display half or full horizontal error bars in the chart.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

HalfVerticalErrorBar.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set whether the chart will display half or full vertical error bars in the chart.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

HorizontalErrorBarWidth.description:
Description: This attribute lets you individually set the width of all horizontal error bars. This attribute over-rides the width applied using `errorBarWidth` attribute.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

VerticalErrorBarWidth.description:
Description: This attribute lets you individually set the width of all vertical error bars. This attribute over-rides the width applied using `errorBarWidth` attribute.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

HorizontalErrorBarColor.description:
Description: Helps you set the color of horizontal error bars on the chart. This attribute over-rides the color applied using `errorBarColor` attribute.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

VerticalErrorBarColor.description:
Description: Helps you set the color of the vertical error bars on the chart. This attribute over-rides the color applied using `errorBarColor` attribute.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

HorizontalErrorBarAlpha.description:
Description: Helps you set the alpha of the horizontal error bars on the chart. This attribute over-rides the alpha applied using `errorBarAlpha` attribute.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

VerticalErrorBarAlpha.description:
Description: Helps you set the alpha of the vertical error bars on the chart. This attribute over-rides the alpha applied using `errorBarAlpha` attribute.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

HorizontalErrorBarThickness.description:
Description: Helps you set the thickness of the horizontal error bars on the chart. This attribute over-rides the thickness applied using `errorBarThickness` attribute.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

VerticalErrorBarThickness.description:
Description: Helps you set the thickness of the vertical error bars on the chart. This attribute over-rides the thickness applied using `errorBarThickness` attribute.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

HorizontalErrorValue.description:
Description: Horizontal error value to be plotted as error bar for individual data items.
      Type: Number
      Range: Numeric Value

VerticalErrorValue.description:
Description: Vertical error value to be plotted as error bar for individual data items.
      Type: Number
      Range: Numeric Value

ShowLabelsAtCenter.description:
Description: Whether to show the labels of each funnel at its side or at the center? This attribute is only applicable for 2D Pyramid chart.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

LabelDistance.description:
Description: Lets you set the horizontal distance between the data labels & funnel slices.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

LabelSepChar.description:
Description: If you've opted to show both funnel label & value, this attribute lets you specify the character using which they'll be separated. By default, a comma (,) is used.
      Type: String

EnableSmartLabels.description:
Description: Whether to use smart lines & labels for the funnel chart?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

SmartLineColor.description:
Description: If you've opted to use smart lines, this attribute lets you define the color for the same.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

SmartLineThickness.description:
Description: Thickness of smart lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

SmartLineAlpha.description:
Description: Alpha of the smart lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

PercentOfPrevious.description:
Description: When showing values in percentage for each slice, you can ask the chart to calculate the percentage value of a slice w.r.t the previous slice (instead of the first slice) by setting this attribute to 1.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

StreamlinedData.description:
Description: Whether to present the data as streamlined data or as section data?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

Is2D.description:
Description: Whether the chart will render as 2D?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

IsSliced.description:
Description: This attribute determines whether a funnel slice appears as a part of the total chart or is sliced out as an individual item.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

IsHollow.description:
Description: Whether the funnel slices will render as filled slices or as hollow ones?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

UseSameSlantAngle.description:
Description: In a streamlined funnel chart, whether all slices will have the same slant angle?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

FunnelYScale.description:
Description: Lets you set the 3D perspective of the funnel. You'll need to restrict your values to a value between 0 and 40 (depending on your funnel chart dimensions) to get a proper drawing.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 40

Palettecolors.description:
Description: This attribute sets the color for each of the individual data plots of the funnel.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

LabelBgColor.description:
Description: Sets the background color for x-axis label text.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

LabelBorderColor.description:
Description: Sets the color of the border around the x-axis label text.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

LabelAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the x-axis label alpha for both font and background.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

LabelBgAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the x-axis label background alpha.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

LabelBorderAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the x-axis label border alpha.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

LabelBorderPadding.description:
Description: Sets the x-axis label border padding.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

LabelBorderRadius.description:
Description: Sets the x-axis label border radius.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

LabelBorderThickness.description:
Description: Sets the x-axis label border thickness.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

LabelBorderDashed.description:
Description: Whether the border around x-axis labels should be rendered using dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (border rendered using straight lines)
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

LabelBorderDashLen.description:
Description: Sets the length of each dash when the border around the x-axis labels are rendered using dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

LabelBorderDashGap.description:
Description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashes when the border around x-axis labels are rendered using dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

LabelLink.description:
Description: Sets a link for every data plot labels.
      Type: URL

LegendItemHoverFontColor.description:
Description: Sets legend item font color on hover
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

LegendItemHiddenColor.description:
Description: Sets the color that applies on both text font and icon when they are in a  disabled / hidden state
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

LegendIconScale.description:
Description: Scaling of legend icon is possible starting FusionWidgets XT. This attribute lets you control the size of the legend icon. The default scale value is 1. Anything less than 1 reduces the size of the legend-icons on the chart. Any value bigger than 1 enlarges the icons. e.g., 0.5 means half the size, whereas, 2 means twice the size.
      Type: Number
      Range: 1-5

LegendScrollBgColor.description:
Description: If you've too many items on the legend, a scroll bar shows up on the same. This attribute lets you configure the background color of the scroll bar.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

ReverseLegend.description:
Description: You can reverse the ordering of datasets in the legend by setting this attribute to 1.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

InteractiveLegend.description:
Description: This attribute lets you interact with the legend in your chart. When you click a particular legend key, the associated slice slides out from the chart. Re-clicking the key causes the slice to slide in.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

LegendNumColumns.description:
Description: The legend items are arranged in columns. Using this attribute, you can set the number of columns. This value undergoes internal checking on judicious use of white-space. In case, the value is found improper, the chart auto-calculates the number of columns. When set to 0, the chart automatically decides the number of columns. The above is applicable when `legendPosition` is set to `BOTTOM``.` If the `legendPosition` is set to `RIGHT`, the number of columns is always set to 1.
      Type: Number
      Range: Zero and Positive Integers

MinimiseWrappingInLegend.description:
Description: Whether to minimize legend item text wrapping.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

DrawCustomLegendIcon.description:
Description: Specifies whether drawing a custom legend icon will be enabled. All legend icon customization attributes will work only if this feature is enabled. 

Default value: 0 (disabled)
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

LegendIconBorderColor.description:
Description: Sets the border color for the legend icon. 

Default value: Data plot border color
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

LegendIconBgColor.description:
Description: Sets the background color for the legend icon. 

Default value: Data plot fill color
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

LegendIconAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the legend icon transparency. 

Default value: 100
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

LegendIconBgAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the legend icon background transparency. 

Default value: 100
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

LegendIconSides.description:
Description: Sets the number of sides for the legend icon. 

Default value: 4
      Type: Number

LegendIconBorderThickness.description:
Description: Sets the thickness of the legend icon border. 

Default value: 1
      Type: Number
      Range: 1-5

LegendIconStartAngle.description:
Description: Sets the starting angle of for drawing the legend icon. 

Default value: 45
      Type: Number

AlignLegendWithCanvas.description:
Description: This attribute if set to `0`, the legend box will be center aligned with respect to the entire width of the chart only if the total width of the legend box is more than the canvas width. By default, the legend box is center aligned with respect to the canvas width and it remains the same if the width of the legend box is less than the canvas width.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowPercentInToolTip.description:
Description: Whether to show percent values in tooltip? If not, the actual values will be shown.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

DateFormat.description:
Description: This attribute helps you specify the input date format for all the dates in your XML. This is a mandatory attribute to specify and once specified, all the dates in your XML data should conform to the format specified herein.
      Type: Date
      Range: 'mm/dd/yyyy' or 'dd/mm/yyyy' or 'yyyy/mm/dd' or 'mm-dd-yyyy' or 'dd-mm-yyyy' or 'yyyy-mm-dd'

OutputDateFormat.description:
Description: You can also specify how the dates look on your Gantt chart using this attribute. This attribute takes the output date format as string. You can build your own output date format string as explained in the section "Configuring date formats".
      Type: String

GanttPaneDuration.description:
Description: If you want your Gantt pane to scroll through a specified time line, you can use this attribute to set what timeline the pane will represent. For example, if you want your Gantt pane to show date only for 3 months and then scroll the rest, you can set this attribute as 3. More of this has been explained in the section "Enable scrolling".
      Type: Number

GanttPaneDurationUnit.description:
Description: If you've opted to scroll the Gantt pane, this attribute lets you choose the unit of your specified duration. More of this has been explained in the section "Enable scrolling".
      Type: String
      Range: 'y','m','d','h','mn' or 's'

ShowFullDataTable.description:
Description: Whether to show full names of the process labels and data columns in grid. If you set this as on, the labels will not wrap and always show in full. When required, a scroll bar will automatically appear for the entire grid.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

GanttWidthPercent.description:
Description: You can opt to set the width of the Gantt view pane in percent using this attribute. The rest of the width will be taken by the grid. If the data grid takes lesser space, the chart will automatically adjust the Gantt pane to assume more width.
      Type: Number
      Range: 10 - 100

ForceGanttWidthPercent.description:
Description: If you want the chart to never automatically adjust the Gantt width and stick to the percent width that you've specified, you can set this attribute to 1.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowTaskStartDate.description:
Description: For each task bar in the Gantt chart, you can show its respective start date on its left. To do so, set this attribute as 1.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowTaskEndDate.description:
Description: For each task bar in the Gantt chart, you can show its end date value too by setting this attribute as 1.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowTaskLabels.description:
Description: Whether to show task labels for each task bar in the Gantt chart. The task labels show up only if they've been defined for the task.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowPercentLabel.description:
Description: If you've used the percentage task feature, you can opt to show the percent complete for each task as part of the task label by setting this attribute as 1.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowSlackAsFill.description:
Description: If you've used the percentage task feature, you can opt to show the slack (percent of work not completed) as either a filled bar or empty bar. To draw as empty bars, set this attribute as 0.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

SlackFillColor.description:
Description: If you've opted to fill the slack bars with color, you can define the color code for the same here.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

ExtendCategoryBg.description:
Description: If you set this attribute as 1, the Gantt pane grid will take the same background and border properties as that of the last category (visual dateline) defined.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ScrollToDate.description:
Description: Chart will automatically scroll to the given date at the time of rendering. This attribute will only work when `ganttPaneDuration` and `ganttPaneDurationUnit` attributes are set as per requirement. This feature is supported by JavaScript Gantt chart only.
      Type: Date
      Range: 'mm/dd/yyyy'

UseVerticalScrolling.description:
Description: Whether to display the vertical scroll bar or not. By default, the attribute is set to 1 and the vertical scroll bar appears depending on the height of the chart. More of this has been explained in the section "Enable scrolling". This feature is supported by JavaScript Gantt chart only.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ForceRowHeight.description:
Description: When the process rows do not occupy the complete height of the chart, this attribute is used to specify the row height configuration. If set to true, each row is set to its own height. Otherwise, the rows occupy the total available height equally. Default value is false.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

GanttLineColor.description:
Description: Lets you specify the color in which the grid border for the Gantt pane view will be drawn.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

GanttLineAlpha.description:
Description: Alpha for the grid border of Gantt view pane.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

GridBorderColor.description:
Description: Color for the data grid border.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

GridBorderAlpha.description:
Description: Alpha for the data grid border.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

GridResizeBarColor.description:
Description: Color for the drag line that appears when resizing the data grid.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

GridResizeBarThickness.description:
Description: Thickness of the drag line that appears when resizing the data grid,
      Type: Number

GridResizeBarAlpha.description:
Description: Alpha of the drag line that appears when resizing the data grid.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

TaskBarRoundRadius.description:
Description: If you want your task bars to be rounded (when not using percent complete feature), you can set the radius of the round corner here. That'll result in all task bars having rounded corners.
      Type: Number

TaskBarFillMix.description:
Description: This attribute lets you specify the gradient fill formula for the task bars. Example: `{light-10},{light-20},{light-60}`
      Type: String

TaskBarFillRatio.description:
Description: If you're using gradient fill formula for the task bars, this attribute lets you specify the ratio for each color in the gradient.
      Type: Numbers separated by comma

DateInToolTip.description:
Description: Whether to show starting and ending date for each task in tooltip?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowHoverBand.description:
Description: Whether to show the vertical and horizontal hover band for both the `categories` and the `processes` objects. This atrribute overrides the value of `showHoverEffect` attribute. This feature is supported by JavaScript Gantt chart only.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

HoverBandColor.description:
Description: Lets you set the hover band color of both the `categories` and the `processes` objects. This feature is supported by JavaScript Gantt chart only.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

HoverBandAlpha.description:
Description: Lets you set the transparency of the hover band for both the `categories` and the `processes` objects. This feature is supported by JavaScript Gantt chart only.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

ShowCategoryHoverBand.description:
Description: Whether to show the vertical color band on mouse hover for the `categories` object. The value of this attribute overrides the value of the `showHoverEffect` attribute. This feature is supported by JavaScript Gantt chart only.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

CategoryHoverBandColor.description:
Description: Lets you set the hover band color for multiple `categories` objects. This feature is supported by JavaScript Gantt chart only.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

CategoryHoverBandAlpha.description:
Description: Lets you set the transparency of the hover band for multiple `categories` objects. This feature is supported by JavaScript Gantt chart only.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

ShowGanttPaneVerticalHoverBand.description:
Description: Whether to show the color band of Gantt pane on mouse hover for multiple `categories` objects. The value of this attribute overrides the value `showHoverEffect` attribute. This feature is supported by JavaScript Gantt chart only.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowProcessHoverBand.description:
Description: Whether to show the horizontal hover band for the `processes` object on mouse hover. The value of this attribute overrides the value `showHoverEffect` attribute. This feature is supported by JavaScript Gantt chart only.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ProcessHoverBandColor.description:
Description: Lets you set the hover band color for all `processes` objects. This feature is supported by JavaScript Gantt chart only.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

ProcessHoverBandAlpha.description:
Description: Lets you set the transparency of the hover band for all `processes` objects. This feature is supported by JavaScript Gantt chart only.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

ShowGanttPaneHorizontalHoverBand.description:
Description: Whether to show the hover bands for the `processes` object of the Gantt pane on mouse hover. The value of this attribute overrides the value `showHoverEffect` attribute. This feature is supported by JavaScript Gantt chart only.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowConnectorHoverEffect.description:
Description: Whether to display the mouse hover effect on connector lines. This feature is supported by JavaScript Gantt chart only.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ConnectorHoverColor.description:
Description: Lets you set the hover color of the connector lines. This feature is supported by JavaScript Gantt chart only.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

ConnectorHoverAlpha.description:
Description: Lets you set the transparency of the hover color of the connector lines. This feature is supported by JavaScript Gantt chart only.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

ConnectorHoverThickness.description:
Description: Lets you set the thickness of the connector lines after the mouse cursor hover. This feature is supported by JavaScript Gantt chart only.
      Type: Number

ShowTaskHoverEffect.description:
Description: Whether to use the mouse hover effect of task bars. This feature is supported by JavaScript Gantt chart only.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

TaskHoverFillColor.description:
Description: Lets you set the color of task fill on mouse hover. This feature is supported by JavaScript Gantt chart only.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

TaskHoverFillAlpha.description:
Description: Lets you set the transparency of the task fill on mouse hover. This feature is supported by JavaScript Gantt chart only.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

SlackHoverFillColor.description:
Description: Lets you set the hover color of the task bar slack. This attribute is not applicable when `showSlackAsFill` is set to 0. This feature is supported by JavaScript Gantt chart only.
      Type: Number

SlackHoverFillAlpha.description:
Description: Lets you set the transparency of the hover color of the task bar slack fill. This attribute is not applicable when `showSlackAsFill` is set to 0. This feature is supported by JavaScript Gantt chart only.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ScrollWidth.description:
Description: Width of scroll bar.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

ScrollBtnWidth.description:
Description: Width of scroll buttons.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

ScrollBtnPadding.description:
Description: Horizontal padding between the scroll bar and its buttons.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

TaskDatePadding.description:
Description: Horizontal padding between the task bars and start of date labels (if you've opted to show them for the chart).
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

MilestoneFont.description:
Description: Sets the font family for the milestone label 

__Note__: The custom milestone label is defined using the `label` attribute belonging to the `milestone` object.
      Type: String

MilestoneFontSize.description:
Description: Sets the font  size for the milestone label 

__Note__: The custom milestone label is defined using the `label` attribute belonging to the `milestone` object.
      Type: String

MilestoneFontColor.description:
Description: Sets the font  color for the milestone label 

__Note__: The custom milestone label is defined using the `label` attribute belonging to the `milestone` object.
      Type: String

MilestoneFontBold.description:
Description: Sets whether the milestone label will be formatted in bold  

__Note__: The custom milestone label is defined using the `label` attribute belonging to the `milestone` object.
      Type: String
      Range: 0/1

MilestoneFontItalic.description:
Description: Sets whether the milestone label will be formatted in italics  

__Note__: The custom milestone label is defined using the `label` attribute belonging to the `milestone` object.
      Type: String
      Range: 0/1

Align.description:
Description: Horizontal alignment position of category labels.
      Type: String
      Range: 'left', 'center' or 'right'

IsBold.description:
Description: Whether to render font as bold for this category?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

IsItalic.description:
Description: Whether to render font as italic for this category?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

IsUnderline.description:
Description: Whether to render font as underline for this category?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowGanttPaneHoverBand.description:
Description: Whether to show the color band of Gantt pane on mouse hover. This feature is supported by JavaScript Gantt chart only.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

VAlign.description:
Description: Vertical alignment position of category labels.
      Type: String
      Range: 'top', 'middle' or 'bottom'

End.description:
Description: End date/time for this category. Needs to be specified in the date/time formats for the chart.
      Type: Date/Time

Start.description:
Description: Start date/time for this category. Needs to be specified in the date/time formats for the chart.
      Type: Date/Time

HeaderAlign.description:
Description: Horizontal alignment position of the header label.
      Type: String
      Range: 'left', 'center' or 'right'

HeaderBgAlpha.description:
Description: Background alpha of the process header.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

HeaderBgColor.description:
Description: Background color of the process header.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

HeaderFont.description:
Description: Font for the process header
      Type: Font face

HeaderFontColor.description:
Description: Font color for the process header
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

HeaderFontSize.description:
Description: Font size for the process header
      Type: Number

HeaderIsBold.description:
Description: Whether process header should appear bold?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

HeaderIsItalic.description:
Description: Whether process header should appear in italics?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

HeaderIsUnderline.description:
Description: Whether process header should appear as underlined?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

HeaderVAlign.description:
Description: Vertical alignment position of the header label.
      Type: String
      Range: 'top', 'middle' or 'bottom'

Headertext.description:
Description: Header label for the processes column in data table.
      Type: String

PositionInGrid.description:
Description: Whether the process column appears as the left-most column of data grid or right-most?
      Type: String
      Range: 'left' or 'right'

Borderalpha.description:
Description: If border is to be shown for task bars, this attribute defines the alpha.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

Borderthickness.description:
Description: If border is to be shown for task bars, this attribute defines the thickness.
      Type: Number

Showborder.description:
Description: Whether to show border for task bars?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

Showenddate.description:
Description: Whether to show end date for each task?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

Showlabels.description:
Description: Whether to show the label for each task (if defined)?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

Showpercentlabel.description:
Description: If percent complete has been defined for each task, whether to show the same as part of label?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

Showstartdate.description:
Description: Whether to show start date for each task?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

HoverFillAlpha.description:
Description: Lets you set the transparency of the hover color for the task bars. This feature is supported by JavaScript Gantt chart only.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

PercentComplete.description:
Description: Each task can be shown as incomplete task by specifying the percent completed here.
      Type: Number

ProcessId.description:
Description: You can relate each task to its process using the process ID, which can be specified here.
      Type: String identifier

ShowAsGroup.description:
Description: Whether to render the task bar visually as a group?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowEndDate.description:
Description: Whether to show end date label for the task bar?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowStartDate.description:
Description: Whether to show start date for the task bar?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

TopPadding.description:
Description: Padding required at the top of the task bar either in pixels or in percent.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels or in percent

HeaderLink.description:
Description: Link for the header.
      Type: Link in FusionCharts format

HeaderText.description:
Description: Label for the header.
      Type: String

HoverThickness.description:
Description: Lets you set the thickness of the hover effect for the connector lines. This feature is supported by JavaScript Gantt chart only.
      Type: Number

IsDashed.description:
Description: Whether the connectors should be rendered as dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (connectors rendered using straight lines)
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

Link.description:
Description: Link for the pie.
      Type: String

FromTaskConnectStart.description:
Description: Whether to connect left side of the starting task bar?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

FromTaskId.description:
Description: ID of the task which will act as the starting point for connector. You'll need to define IDs for each task before you can define connectors.
      Type: String ID

ToTaskConnectStart.description:
Description: Whether to connect left side of the ending task bar?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ToTaskId.description:
Description: ID of the task which will act as the ending point for connector.
      Type: String ID

Date.description:
Description: Date for the milestone in the specified date format.
      Type: Date

StartAngle.description:
Description: Starting angle for the star/polygon.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0-360

TaskId.description:
Description: ID of the task to which this milestone relates to. You must define task IDs before you can use milestones.
      Type: String ID

HoverBorderColor.description:
Description: Lets you set the color of the border of milestone when hovered.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

HoverBorderAlpha.description:
Description: Lets you set the transparency of the border of milestone when hovered.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

SetAdaptiveYMin.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set whether the y-axis lower limit will be 0 (in case of all positive values on chart) or should the y-axis lower limit adapt itself to a different figure based on values provided to the chart.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

TicksBelowGraph.description:
Description: Whether tick marks & values will appear under the graph or above it?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

PlaceTicksInside.description:
Description: Whether to place ticks inside the gauge or outside?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

PlotAsDot.description:
Description: Whether to plot the value as bar or as dot?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

PlotFillPercent.description:
Description: Width percent of the color range that the plot fill bar should occupy.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

Target.description:
Description: Sets a vertical target line for the bullet.
      Type: Number
      Range: Between minValue & maxValue

TargetColor.description:
Description: Color for the target line.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

TargetThickness.description:
Description: Thickness for the target line.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

TargetFillPercent.description:
Description: Width percent of the color range that the target fill bar should occupy.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

TargetCapStyle.description:
Description: This attribute specifies the shape to be used for the ends of the target line. 

Default value : round
      Type: String
      Range: 'round','square','butt','inherit'

ColorRangeFillMix.description:
Description: This attribute specifies the gradient fill formula for the color range. Example: `{light-10},{light-20},{light-60}` 

 __Note:__ This attribute is not supported in IE8
      Type: String

ColorRangeFillRatio.description:
Description: This attribute sets the ratio of each color separated by comma using `colorRangeFillMix` attribute.
      Type: Numbers separated by comma

ShowColorRangeBorder.description:
Description: Whether to show border for color range?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ColorRangeBorderColor.description:
Description: Border color for the color range.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

ColorRangeBorderThickness.description:
Description: Border thickness for the color range.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

ColorRangeBorderAlpha.description:
Description: Border alpha for the color range.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

ShowHoverAnimation.description:
Description: This attribute animates the plot when hovered.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

TargetHoverColor.description:
Description: Sets the color for the target line when hovered.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex color code

TargetHoverAlpha.description:
Description: This attribute sets the transparency for the target line when hovered.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

TargetHoverThickness.description:
Description: This attribute sets the thickness for the target line when hovered.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

ShowPlotBorderOnHover.description:
Description: Sets whether to show the border for the bar when hovered.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

PlotBorderHoverColor.description:
Description: This attribute sets the border color of the plot when hovered.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex color code

PlotBorderHoverAlpha.description:
Description: This attribute sets the transparency of plot border when hovered.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

PlotBorderHoverThickness.description:
Description: This attribute sets the thickness of plot border when hovered.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

TrType.description:
Description: Specifies the type of data provided in the top-right label. This value is displayed in the tool tip.
      Type: String
      Range:

TlType.description:
Description: Specifies the type of data provided in the top-left label. This value is displayed in the tool tip.
      Type: String
      Range:

BrType.description:
Description: Specifies the type of data provided in the bottom-right label. This value is displayed in the tool tip.
      Type: String
      Range:

BlType.description:
Description: Specifies the type of data provided in the bottom-left label. This value is displayed in the tool tip.
      Type: String
      Range:

InteractiveAnimationDuration.description:
Description: Sets the duration of the animation that takes place when the legends are used to show or hide dataplots.
      Type: Number

MapByCategory.description:
Description: Allows you to render a category based heat map chart.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowXaxisLabels.description:
Description: This attribute is used to show or hide the x axis or the column labels.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

PlaceXAxisLabelsOnTop.description:
Description: This attribute when set to '1', allows you to display the x-axis labels on top of the chart canvas.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

XAxisLineColor.description:
Description: Sets color of the x-axis of the chart.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

RotatexAxisLabels.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set whether the data labels would show up as rotated labels on the chart.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowYaxisLabels.description:
Description: This attribute is used to show or hide y axis or the row labels.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

PlotBorderDashed.description:
Description: Whether the border around the data plots should be rendered using dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (border rendered using straight lines)
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

PlotBorderDashLen.description:
Description: Sets the length of each dash when the border around the data plots are rendered using dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

PlotBorderDashGap.description:
Description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashes when the border around the data plots are rendered using dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

PlotFillAngle.description:
Description: If you have opted to fill the plot (column, area etc.) as gradient, this attribute lets you set the fill angle for gradient.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0-360

PlotFillRatio.description:
Description: If you have opted to fill the plot (column, area etc.) as gradient, this attribute lets you set the ratio for gradient.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

LabelXPadding.description:
Description: This attribute sets the vertical space between the x-axis labels and canvas bottom edge.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

LabelYPadding.description:
Description: It sets the horizontal space between the y-axis labels and the canvas right edge.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

MaxLabelWidthPercent.description:
Description: Restricts the maximum space allotted for the y-axis data labels with respect to the chart's width. If a data label is longer than the specified percentage width then it will either be wrapped or get truncated, subject to the availability of vertical space. Unnecessary space is not reserved for the labels. If all the labels are shorter than the specified maximum width, this value is not applied.
      Type: Numeric
      Range: In Pixels

MinLabelWidthPercent.description:
Description: Restricts the minimum length of data labels in terms of percentage of the chart's width that the data labels can occupy. The space thus calculated stays reserved even if the label width is less than the minimum width.
      Type: Number
      Range: 1-100

TlFont.description:
Description: Allows user to set Top Left font for the tooltext
      Type: String
      Range: Font Name

TlFontSize.description:
Description: Allows user to set Top Left font size for the tooltext
      Type: Number
      Range: 6 - 72

TlFontColor.description:
Description: Allows user to set Top Left font color for the tooltext
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex color code

TrFont.description:
Description: Allows user to set Top Right font for the tooltext
      Type: String
      Range: Font Name

TrFontSize.description:
Description: Allows user to set Top Right font size for the tooltext
      Type: Number
      Range: 6 - 72

TrFontColor.description:
Description: Allows user to set Top Right font color for the tooltext
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex color code

BlFont.description:
Description: Allows user to set Bottom Left font for the tooltext
      Type: String
      Range: Font Name

BlFontSize.description:
Description: Allows user to set Bottom Left font size for the tooltext
      Type: Number
      Range: 6 - 72

BlFontColor.description:
Description: Allows user to set Bottom Left font color for the tooltext
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex color code

BrFont.description:
Description: Allows user to set Bottom Right font for the tooltext
      Type: String
      Range: Font Name

BrFontSize.description:
Description: Allows user to set Bottom Right font size for the tooltext
      Type: Number
      Range: 6 - 72

BrFontColor.description:
Description: Allows user to set Bottom Right font color for the tooltext
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex color code

LegendPointerColor.description:
Description: Sets the legend pointer color for a gradient legend.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

LegendPointerAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the legend pointer transparency for a gradient legend.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

LegendPointerBorderAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the transparency for the legend pointer border for a gradient legend.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

Legendpointerbordercolor.description:
Description: Sets the color for the border of the legend pointer.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex color code

AutoOrderLegendIcon.description:
Description: Allows you to show the legend icon in ascending order in icon legend.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

RowId.description:
Description: Specifies the position of the row where the data it is to be placed in the chart. If the `rows` object is used then it is mandatory to use the same id which is defined in the `row` object by the `id` attribute.
      Type: String

ColumnId.description:
Description: Specifies the position of the column where the data it is to be placed in the chart. If the `columns` object is used then it is mandatory to use the same id which is defined in the `column` object by the `id` attribute.
      Type: String

ColorRangeLabel.description:
Description: This attribute is used to provide the color-range label which is defined in the `color` object of the `colorRange` object. It is used only in category based heat map chart.
      Type: String

TlLabel.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to display a label on the top-left corner of a data plot.
      Type: Number/String

TrLabel.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to display a label on the top-right corner of a data plot.
      Type: Number/String

BlLabel.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to display a label on the bottom-left corner of a data plot.
      Type: Number/String

BrLabel.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to display a label on the bottom-left corner of a data plot.
      Type: Number/String

TicksBelowGauge.description:
Description: Whether to show ticks below the gauge scale or above?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

GaugeFillColor.description:
Description: Background fill color for gauge
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

LedSize.description:
Description: This sets the size of each LED bar.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

LedGap.description:
Description: This sets the distance or the gap between two LED bars.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

UseSameFillColor.description:
Description: If you've defined color range for the chart, the LED bars take their fill color based on color range. But, if you want all the LED bars to use the color of the last color range (which matches current value), set this attribute to 1.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

UseSameFillBgColor.description:
Description: If you want all the background (non-activated) LED blocks to use the color of the last color range (which matches current value), set this attribute to 1.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ReversalValue.description:
Description: The numerical (absolute) value which determines whether to make a horizontal shift to plot the next point. For example, if the Kagi line is running up (rally or decline in trend does not matter) and the next point to plot is having a value lower than the current point, then we have to run down. If the deviation between the 2 points is greater than the `reversalValue`, only then we make a horizontal shift to right and move down. Else, the next point is neglected in plotting and we do not move horizontally.
      Type: Number
      Range:

ReversalPercentage.description:
Description: Same as `reversalValue` attribute, but in percentage (instead of absolute value).
      Type: Number
      Range: In Percent

MaxHShiftPercent.description:
Description: Maximum horizontal shift possible. Percentage value with respect to the canvas width.
      Type: Number
      Range: Percent

RallyColor.description:
Description: Color of line denoting rally trend.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

RallyAlpha.description:
Description: Transparency of line denoting rally trend.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

RallyThickness.description:
Description: Thickness of line denoting rally trend.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

RallyDashed.description:
Description: Whether the line denoting rally trend should be rendered as dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (line rendered using straight lines)
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

RallyDashGap.description:
Description: Sets the length of each dash when line denoting rally trend are rendered as dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

RallyDashLen.description:
Description: Sets the gap between consecutive dashes when line denoting rally trend are rendered as dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

DeclineColor.description:
Description: Color of line denoting decline trend.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

DeclineAlpha.description:
Description: Transparency of line denoting decline trend.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

DeclineThickness.description:
Description: Thickness of line denoting decline trend.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

DeclineDashed.description:
Description: Whether the line denoting decline trend should be rendered as dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (line rendered using straight lines)
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

DeclineDashGap.description:
Description: Sets the length of each dash when line denoting decline trend are rendered as dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

DeclineDashLen.description:
Description: Sets the gap between consecutive dashes when line denoting decline trend are rendered as dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

LineDashLen.description:
Description: Sets the length of each dash when lines are rendered as dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

LineDashGap.description:
Description: Sets the gap between consecutive dashes when lines are rendered as dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

ValueAbovePointer.description:
Description: Whether to show pointer value above/below the pointer?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

PointerOnTop.description:
Description: Whether to show the pointer above or below the chart?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowGaugeLabels.description:
Description: Whether the gauge (color range scale) labels will be visible or not?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

GaugeRoundRadius.description:
Description: Whether to use rounded corners for the gauge? If yes, specify the round radius (in pixels) here.This feature in not supported in JavaScript Horizontal Liner gauge.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

PointerRadius.description:
Description: Radius of the pointer.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

PointerBgColor.description:
Description: Fill color for the pointer.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

PointerBgAlpha.description:
Description: Fill alpha for the pointer.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

PointerSides.description:
Description: Number of sides for the pointer.
      Type: Number
      Range: 3-15

PointerBorderThickness.description:
Description: Border thickness for pointer.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

PointerBorderColor.description:
Description: Border color for pointer.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

PointerBorderAlpha.description:
Description: Border alpha for pointer.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

ShowPointerShadow.description:
Description: Whether to apply shadow of pointer. If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the gauge inherits the default value from `showShadow` attribute.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

PointerBgHoverColor.description:
Description: This attribute sets the color of the pointer when hovered.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex color code

PointerBgHoverAlpha.description:
Description: This attribute sets the transparency of the pointer when hovered.
      Type: Number
      Range: 1 - 100

ShowBorderOnHover.description:
Description: Sets whether to show the border for the pointer when hovered.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

PointerBorderHoverThickness.description:
Description: Sets the thickness of the border for pointer when hovered.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

PointerBorderHoverColor.description:
Description: Sets the border color for pointers when hovered.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex color code

PointerBorderHoverAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the transparency of border for pointers when hovered.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

PointerHoverRadius.description:
Description: This attribute sets the radius of the pointer when hovered.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

Sides.description:
Description: Number of sides this pointer will have.
      Type: Number
      Range: 3-15

Base.description:
Description: Using this attribute, you can set the base of the logarithmic chart. The value has to be a positive numeric value apart from 1.
      Type: Number
      Range: Positive Numeric Value apart from 1

InvertYAxis.description:
Description: Whether to use inverted y-axis so that y-axis upper limit appears at canvas bottom instead of top.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowMinorDivLineValues.description:
Description: Whether to show minor divisional lines. Minor divisional lines are incremental scale lines between any two major division line.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

NumMinorDivLines.description:
Description: Number of minor division lines to be plotted between any two major divisional lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: Value greater than 0.

MinorDivLineColor.description:
Description: Color of minor divisional lines.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

MinorDivLineThickness.description:
Description: Thickness of minor divisional lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

MinorDivLineAlpha.description:
Description: Alpha of minor divisional lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

AllowSelection.description:
Description: Whether to show the checkboxes for each axis, thereby allowing the user to show or hide data-sets belonging to that particular axis.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

AllowAxisShift.description:
Description: Whether to allow shifting of axis from one end to other, upon clicking the same.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

AxisColor.description:
Description: Sets color of all the y-axis in the chart.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

CheckBoxColor.description:
Description: Color for the checkbox that shows up for each axis.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

AxisLineThickness.description:
Description: Thickness of the line using which axis will be plotted.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

AxisOnLeft.description:
Description: Whether to show the axis on left side of canvas or right side of canvas.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowAxis.description:
Description: Whether this axis is a visible axis or imaginary axis.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

TickWidth.description:
Description: Width of the tick marks that extend from axis.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

Title.description:
Description: Title of the axis.
      Type: String
      Range:

TransposeAxis.description:
Description: If you hide a dataset using legend icon, this attribute (when set to `1`) will compute the axes limit with respect to maximum and minimum value of the visible dataset(s). 

Default value: 0
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

CenterXaxisName.description:
Description: This attribute when set to '1', allows you to align the x-axis name with respect to the height of the chart. When set to '0', the x-axis name is aligned with respect to the height of the canvas.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

RotateXAxisName.description:
Description: If you do not wish to rotate x-axis name, set this as 0. It specifically comes to use when you've special characters (UTF8) in your x-axis name that do not show up in rotated mode.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

XAxisNameWidth.description:
Description: If you opt to not rotate x-axis name, you can choose a maximum width that will be applied to x-axis name.
      Type: Number
      Range: (In Pixels)

OverlapBars.description:
Description: Whether to overlap bars over each other to give a richer 3D look. If there are too many bars on the chart, it will automatically overlap.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

PlotPaddingPercent.description:
Description: This attribute adds white space between columns/bars representing a single category. Applicable only when there are more than one datasets.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

Visible.description:
Description: Sets whether a dataset will be visible on the chart, when the chart is first loaded. This attribute overrides the `initiallyHidden` attribute. 

 __Default Value__ : 1
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

SyncAxisLimits.description:
Description: Setting this attribute to 1 lets you synchronize the limits of both the primary and secondary axes.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

DrawVerticalJoins.description:
Description: Allows you to set whether to join the parallel horizontal planes by drawing vertical lines on the canvas. By default, this attribute is set to 1.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

UseForwardSteps.description:
Description: Whether to display the chart in forward progressive mode.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

LegendNumColumn.description:
Description: If your chart contains multiple series, the legend is displayed as a grid comprising of multiple legend keys. With the help of this attribute you can specify the number of columns that are to be displayed in the legend.
      Type: Number
      Range: Positive Integer

ShowSum.description:
Description: If you want to show sum of all the columns in a given stacked column, set this attribute to 1.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

UsePercentDistribution.description:
Description: If you do not wish to show data values as percentage figures, set this attribute to 0.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowXAxisPercentValues.description:
Description: This attribute specifies whether percentage values should be should along the x-axis or not. 

 Default value: 1
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

WidthPercent.description:
Description: FusionCharts XT automatically calculates the horizontal width of the columns based on the data provided by you. But, using this attribute you can specify different width values to each segment. The values in each category must be specified in a way that sum of all the figures equals to 100 percent in order to render your chart successfully.
      Type: Number
      Range: 1-100

Ratio.description:
Description: If you've opted to show columns as gradients, this attribute lets you control the ratio of each color. Please see Gradients under Advanced Charting Section to get more information.
      Type: String
      Range: Comma separated list of ratios

PaletteColors.description:
Description: While the `palette` attribute allows to select a palette theme that applies to chart background, canvas, font and tool-tips, it does not change the colors of data items (that is, column, line, pie etc.). Using `paletteColors` attribute, you can specify your custom list of hex colors for the data items. The list of colors have to be separated by comma. For example, `"paletteColors": "#FF0000, #0372AB, #FF5904..."`. The chart will cycle through the list of specified colors and then render the data plot accordingly. To use the same set of colors throughout all your charts in a web application, you can store the list of palette colors in your application globally and then provide the same in each chart JSON.
      Type: String
      Range: List of hex color codes separated by comma

UnescapeLinks.description:
Description: Internally the chart decodes a Url that you set as link. Before invoking the link it again encodes the Url. If you are passing multilingual characters via a Url or do not want this decode-encode mechanism to be handled by chart you can set,`unescapeLinks='0'`.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowLabels.description:
Description: Allows you to show or hide the labels on the chart.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowValues.description:
Description: Allows you to show or hide the values on the chart.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowValuesInTooltip.description:
Description: Allows you to show the values of the chart in the tooltip.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowPercentValues.description:
Description: Allows you to show the values as percentage on the chart.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowPercentInTooltip.description:
Description: Allows you to show the percentage values of the chart in tooltip.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowPlotBorder.description:
Description: Whether the pie border would show up.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

PlotBorderAlpha.description:
Description: Alpha for pie border.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

PlotFillAlpha.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set the fill alpha for plot.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

ShadowColor.description:
Description: Lets you set a color of the shadow for pie.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

ShadowAlpha.description:
Description: Lets you set alpha of the shadow for pie.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

PlotFillColor.description:
Description: Fill color for all the pies.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

Pieborderthickness.description:
Description: Fill color for all the pies.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

Piefillalpha.description:
Description: Fill color for all the pies.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

PieRadius.description:
Description: This attribute lets you explicitly set the outer radius of the chart. The chart automatically calculates the best fit pie radius for the chart. This attribute is useful if you want to enforce one of your own values.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

InnerRadius.description:
Description: This attribute lets you explicitly set the inner radius of the chart. This attribute is useful if you want to enforce one of your own values.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

PieBorderColor.description:
Description: Set the border color of the pie. By default, it is set to 'FFFFFF'.
      Type: Hex code
      Range:

TotalAngle.description:
Description: This attribute sets the total angle of the arcs.  

Default value: 360
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 360

CenterAngle.description:
Description: If an imaginary line bisect the pie chart, the angle that line makes with the base might be defined as the center angle for it. 

 When you set `totalAngle` less than 360, you can set different positions for the plot using `centerAngle`
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 360

OriginX.description:
Description: This attribute sets the x-coordinate for the center of the plot.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

OriginY.description:
Description: This attribute sets the y-coordinate for the center of the plot.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

UseHoverColor.description:
