Description: Sets the transparency of the gradient legend scale.
      Type: NUmber
      Range: 0 - 100

LegendScaleLineThickness.description:
Description: Sets the thickness of the gradient legend scale.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0-5

Legendaxisbordercolor.description:
Description: Sets color for the gradient legend's axis border.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

Legendaxisborderalpha.description:
Description: Sets transparency for the gradient legend's axis border.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

OutCnvBaseFont.description:
Description: Sets the base font family for all the text that lies outside the chart canvas.
      Type: String
      Range: Font Name

OutCnvBaseFontSize.description:
Description: Sets the base font size for all the text that lies outside the chart canvas.
      Type: Number
      Range: 6 - 72

OutCnvBaseFontColor.description:
Description: Sets the base font color for all the text that lies outside the chart canvas..
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

Label.description:
Description: Sets the label for a node. 

 __Note__: The `label` attribute replaces the `name` attribute. Previously, either one of the attributes could be used to set the label. Support for the `name` attribute has been discontinued since v3.10.0.
      Type: String

SValue.description:
Description: Sets the secondary value and maps the color of the rectangle (node).
      Type: Number

Fillcolor.description:
Description: Sets the fill color for a node
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

FontColor.description:
Description: Sets the font color for a node label
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

StartLabel.description:
Description: Sets the lower limit label for the gradient scale.
      Type: String

EndLabel.description:
Description: Sets the upper limit label for the gradient scale.
      Type: String

Gradient.description:
Description: Sets whether the gradient legend will be displayed.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

MapByPercent.description:
Description: Sets whether the data values will be rendered in percentage.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

MinValue.description:
Description: Sets the minimum value or the lower limit of the numeric range and the gradient scale.
      Type: Number

Code.description:
Description: Sets the color for a numeric range.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

MaxValue.description:
Description: Sets the upper limit of a numeric range.
      Type: Number

Showhovereffect.description:
Description: Using this attribute you can set the hover effect of the bullet. 

__Default value__: 1
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowSumAtEnd.description:
Description: Whether to add a summation column as the last column in chart.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

SumLabel.description:
Description: If you have opted to add a summation column as the last column of chart, this attribute lets you set the label for the same.
      Type: String
      Range:

PositiveColor.description:
Description: If you want all the positive columns (including in-data sum columns) on the chart to show in a single color, specify the same here.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

NegativeColor.description:
Description: If you want all the negative columns (including in-data sum columns) on the chart to show in a single color, specify the same here.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

ShowConnectors.description:
Description: Whether to show the connector lines which connect two subsequent columns.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ConnectorColor.description:
Description: Color of the connector line.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

ConnectorAlpha.description:
Description: Alpha of the connector line.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

ConnectorThickness.description:
Description: Thickness of the connector line.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

ConnectorDashed.description:
Description: Whether the connector line should be rendered as dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (connector line rendered using straight lines)
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ConnectorDashLen.description:
Description: Sets the length of each dash when connector line is rendered as dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

ConnectorDashGap.description:
Description: Sets the gap between consecutive dashes when connector line is rendered as dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

PositiveHoverColor.description:
Description: Sets color for the positive value plots when hovered.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex color code

NegativeHoverColor.description:
Description: Sets color for the negative value plots when hovered.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex color code

IsSum.description:
Description: Whether the set value should represent the sum of previous set values in the water fall chart. You can put a sum column at any position in the chart (barring the first position, as you need at least one data point to calculate sum).
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

Cumulative.description:
Description: Whether the sum represents the cumulative sum (of all the columns to the left of this sum column) or non-cumulative sum (of all the columns to the left of this column, but after the last sum column).
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowTerminalValidData.description:
Description: In Zoomline charts, to display the data at the initial level, data are compressed. Initial level fails to display the first and last data from the data set provided. This attribute if set to `1`, displays the first and last valid data even if the value arises between the broken data set.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

Pixelsperlabel.description:
Description: Sets the distance between the labels of the x-axis.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

CompactDataMode.description:
Description: Indicates whether the XML is in compact form or not.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

DataSeparator.description:
Description: Specifies the separation character used in compact XML.
      Type: Character
      Range: Any character

AllowPinMode.description:
Description: Used for enabling/disabling the pin mode feature, which is active by default.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

NumVisibleLabels.description:
Description: Specifies the number of data labels that are to be visible in one screen. As this attribute imposes the equispace constraint, values greater than 5 and less than 10 (if total data plots __=__ 10) will not be applicable due to violation of this constraint.
      Type: Number
      Range: Any number

DisplayStartIndex.description:
Description: Indicates the index of the data label that will appear to the extreme left of the chart.
      Type: Number
      Range: Any number > 1

DisplayEndIndex.description:
Description: Indicates the index of the data label that is to appear at the extreme right of the chart. Using `displayStartIndex` and `displayEndIndex` attributes you can set the range of data labels that'll be visible when the chart first renders.
      Type: Number
      Range: Any Number> 1

PixelsPerPoint.description:
Description: Specifies the number of pixels to be used for producing a data point. A greater number will result in high quality display.
      Type: Number
      Range: Any number

ShowXAxisLine.description:
Description: This attribute if set to _0_, hides the x-axis of the chart. 

__Default value__: 1
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

Xaxislinethickness.description:
Description: Sets the thickness of the x-axis line of the chart.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

ShowYAxisLine.description:
Description: This attribute if set to _0_, hides the y-axis of the chart. 

__Default value__: 1
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

YAxisLineColor.description:
Description: Sets color of the y-axis of the chart.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

YAxisLineThickness.description:
Description: Sets the thickness of the y-axis line of the chart.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

Showcanvasborder.description:
Description: This attribute if set to _1_, shows a border around the canvas of the chart. 

__Default value__: 0
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ZoomPaneBorderColor.description:
Description: Sets the color of the zoom pane border.
      Type: Color
      Range: Any (color code without the # prefix)

ZoomPaneBgColor.description:
Description: Sets the background color of the zoom pane.
      Type: Color
      Range: Any (color code without the # prefix)

ZoomPaneBgAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the alpha of the zoom pane.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

PinLineThicknessDelta.description:
Description: Sets the thickness of the pinned line when the chart is put to pin line mode.
      Type: Number
      Range: Any number

PinPaneBgColor.description:
Description: Sets the background color of the pin pane.
      Type: Color
      Range: Any (color code without the # prefix)

PinPaneBgAlpha.description:
Description: Sets the alpha of the pin pane.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

BtnSwitchToPinModeTooltext.description:
Description: Replaces the default tooltext of 'Switch to Pin Mode' button with provided string.
      Type: String
      Range: Any string.

ShowPeakData.description:
Description: Specifies whether peak data will be shown. 

Default value: 0 (disabled)
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

MaxPeakDataLimit.description:
Description: Defines the upper limit for peak data. Any value greater than this value will be considered peak data. If the value of `minPeakDataLimit` attribute is set more than `maxPeakDataLimit` attribute, the values between the range will be considered as peak data.
      Type: Number

MinPeakDataLimit.description:
Description: Defines the lower limit for peak data. Any value lower than this value will be considered peak data. If the value of `maxPeakDataLimit` attribute is set less than `minPeakDataLimit` attribute, the values between the range will be considered as peak data.
      Type: Number

ScrollColor.description:
Description: Color for scroll bar.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

Flatscrollbars.description:
Description: This attribute can be used to set the scroll bar to flat or the basic one. 

__Default value__: 1
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ScrollHeight.description:
Description: Required height for scroll bar.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

Scrollshowbuttons.description:
Description: Sets whether to show the left and right scroll button.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

AnchorMinRenderDistance.description:
Description: This attribute is used for specifying the minimum distance (between dataplots) for the anchors to become visible.
      Type: Number
      Range:

ShowAlternateHGridColor.description:
Description: Whether to show alternate colored horizontal grid bands.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

AlternateHGridColor.description:
Description: Color of the alternate horizontal grid bands.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

AlternateHGridAlpha.description:
Description: Alpha (transparency) of the alternate horizontal grid bands.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

UseCrossLine.description:
Description: There are two ways of displaying tool-tips in a zoomline chart. One is to use a cross-line, which is a vertical line that displays data values for all series on that data point. The other way is to use traditional tool-tips that display values on a data point when hovered upon. Default value is 1 which uses cross-line. Set this attribute value to 0 to use traditional tool-tips.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

CrossLineThickness.description:
Description: If you've opted to show the tool-tips using cross-line, this attribute lets you define the thickness of cross-line.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

CrossLineColor.description:
Description: If you've opted to show the tool-tips using cross-line, this attribute lets you define the color of cross-line.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

CrossLineAlpha.description:
Description: If you've opted to show the tool-tips using cross-line, this attribute lets you define the transparency of cross-line.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

CrossLineLabelSize.description:
Description: This attribute lets you define the label font size of cross-line.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

CrossLineLabelFont.description:
Description: This attribute lets you define the label font of cross-line.
      Type: String
      Range: Font Name

CrossLineValueSize.description:
Description: This attribute lets you define the font size of values getting displayed using cross-line.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

CrossLineValueFont.description:
Description: This attribute lets you define the font of values getting displayed using cross-line.
      Type: String
      Range: Font Name

CanvasPadding.description:
Description: Lets you set the space between the canvas border and first & last data points
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

SetAdaptiveSYMin.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set whether the secondary y-axis lower limit will be 0 (in case of all positive values on chart) or should the y-axis lower limit adapt itself to a different figure based on values provided to the chart.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

SYAxisMinValue.description:
Description: This attribute helps you explicitly set the lower limit of the secondary y-axis. If you don't specify this value, it is automatically calculated by the chart based on the data provided by you.
      Type: Number

SYAxisMaxValue.description:
Description: This attribute helps you explicitly set the upper limit of the secondary y-axis. If you don't specify this value, it is automatically calculated by the chart based on the data provided by you.
      Type: Number

ForceSYAxisValueDecimals.description:
Description: Whether to force decimal places for y-axis values on secondary y-axis?
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

SFormatNumberScale.description:
Description: Configuration whether to add K (thousands) and M (millions) to a number belonging to secondary axis after truncating and rounding it - e.g., if `sFormatNumberScale` is set to 1, 10434 will become 1.04K (with decimalPrecision set to 2 places). Same with numbers in millions - an M will be added at the end.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

SDefaultNumberScale.description:
Description: The default unit of the numbers belonging to secondary axis.
      Type: String

SNumberScaleUnit.description:
Description: Unit of each block of the scale of secondary y-axis.
      Type: String

SNumberScaleValue.description:
Description: Range of the various blocks that constitute the scale for secondary y-axis.
      Type: String

SForceNumberScale.description:
Description: If a data value, to be plotted on the secondary y-axis, is less than the lowest given number is the number scale, this attribute forces the lower value of the  `sNumberScaleUnit` to be applied to that data value.  This attribute works only when `sFormatNumberScale: 1` and the `sDefaultNumberScale` attribute is not defined. 

For example, if `sNumberScaleUnit: K, M`, `sNumberScaleValue: 1000, 1000`, and `sForceNumberScale: 1`, a data value of __400__ will be rendered as __0.40K__.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

SScaleRecursively.description:
Description: To scale the numbers recursively only for the secondary y-axis you need to set this attribute to '1'.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

SMaxScaleRecursion.description:
Description: How many recursions to complete during recursive scaling for the numbers of the secondary y-axis? -1 completes the entire set of recursion.
      Type: Number

SScaleSeparator.description:
Description: What character to use to separate the scales that are generated after recursion of the secondary y-axis?
      Type: String

SNumberPrefix.description:
Description: Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers belonging to secondary axis.
      Type: String
      Range: Character

SNumberSuffix.description:
Description: Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers belonging to secondary axis.
      Type: String
      Range: Character

SDecimals.description:
Description: Number of decimal places to which all numbers belonging to secondary axis will be rounded to.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0-10

Category.description:
Description: Lets you set the data labels that will be rendered along the x-axis
      Type: String

Data.description:
Description: Sets the data values for a dataset. Data values are separated using the character specified in the `dataSeparator` attribute.
      Type: Number

ShowVLimits.description:
Description: Whether to show chart limit values of the x-axis. If not specified `showXAxisValues` attribute overrides this value.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowVDivLineValues.description:
Description: Whether to show vertical div line values. If not specified `showXAxisValues` attribute overrides this value.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

AdjustVDiv.description:
Description: FusionCharts XT automatically tries to adjust divisional lines and limit values of the x-axis based on the data provided. However, if you want to set your explicit lower and upper limit values and number of divisional lines for the x-axis, first set this attribute to false. That will disable automatic adjustment of divisional lines.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

SetAdaptiveXMin.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set whether the x-axis lower limit will be 0 (in case of all positive values on chart) or should the x-axis lower limit adapt itself to a different figure based on values provided to the chart.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowRegressionLine.description:
Description: This attribute when set to '1' draws regression lines for all the datasets in the chart.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowYOnX.description:
Description: When it is set to '1' the regression lines are drawn using Y On X mode and when the attribute is set to '0' the regression lines are drawn using X On Y mode. By default, this attribute is set to '1'.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

RegressionLineColor.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the color of all the regression lines in a chart.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

RegressionLineThickness.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the thickness of all the regression lines in a chart.
      Type: Number
      Range:

RegressionLineAlpha.description:
Description: This attribute allows you to set the transparency of all the regression lines in a chart.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

DrawLines.description:
Description: You can opt to connect the scatter points using lines. This attribute helps you configure that.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

MaxZoomLimit.description:
Description: Sets the maximum zoom limit. For example, you set this attribute to __50__, the user can zoom only up to 100 times of the original view. 

__Default value__: 1000
      Type: Number
      Range: 1-1000

StaticRadius.description:
Description: Sets the radius of the plots to static over any zoom level. i.e. if we set `staticRadius` = `0`, then even if we zoom the chart for number of times the radius of the data plot remains the same. 

__Default value__: 0
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

ShowXAxisValues.description:
Description: FusionCharts XT x-axis is divided into horizontal sections using div (divisional) lines. Each div line assumes a value based on its position. Using this attribute you can set whether to show those div line (x-axis) values or not. This attribute shows or hides the x-axis divisional lines and limits. When specified the values of `showVLimits` and `showVDivLineValues` overrides the value of this attribute.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

XAxisValuesStep.description:
Description: By default, all div lines show their values. However, you can opt to display every x(th) div line value using this attribute.
      Type: Number
      Range: 1 or above

XAxisLabelMode.description:
Description: This attribute is used to render the x-axis labels in three different modes. The modes are as following: AUTO - Allows the x-axis labels to inherit the properties of y-axis (numeric calculations), ignoring the properties of the `categories` object if present in the data. CATEGORIES - This mode is the default mode of `xAxisLabelMode`. It allows the chart to show the properties of the `categories` object on the x-axis labels. MIXED - Allows the chart to show both the properties of y-axis (numeric calculations) and `categories` object on the x-axis simultaneously.
      Type: String
      Range: AUTO 
CATEGORIES
MIXED

Showyaxisline.description:
Description: This attribute if set to _0_, hides the y-axis of the chart. 

__Default value__: 1
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

Yaxislinecolor.description:
Description: Sets color of the y-axis of the chart.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

Yaxislinethickness.description:
Description: Sets the thickness of the y-axis line of the chart.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

ForceXAxisValueDecimals.description:
Description: Whether to forcefully attach decimal places to all x-axis values. For example, If you limit the maximum number of decimal digits to 2, a number like 55.345 will be rounded to 55.34. This does not mean that all x-axis numbers will be displayed with a fixed number of decimal places. For instance 55 will not be displayed as 55.00 and 55.1 will not become 55.10. In order to have fixed number of decimal places attached to all x-axis numbers, set this attribute to 1.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

XAxisValueDecimals.description:
Description: If you've opted not to adjust vertical div lines, you can specify the decimal precision of the div line values using this attribute.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0-10

DrawQuadrant.description:
Description: Whether to draw quadrants on the chart.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

QuadrantXVal.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set the position of the vertical quadrant line.
      Type: Number
      Range: Numeric Value

QuadrantYVal.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set the position of the horizontal quadrant line.
      Type: Number
      Range: Numeric Value

QuadrantLineColor.description:
Description: Lets you set the color of the quadrant lines.
      Type: Color
      Range: Hex Color Code

QuadrantLineThickness.description:
Description: Lets you set the thickness of the quadrant lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In Pixels

QuadrantLineAlpha.description:
Description: Lets you control the transparency of the quadrant lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

QuadrantLineDashed.description:
Description: Whether the quadrant line should be rendered as dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (quadrant line rendered using straight lines)
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

QuadrantLineDashLen.description:
Description: Sets the length of each dash when quadrant line is rendered as dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

QuadrantLineDashGap.description:
Description: Sets the gap between consecutive dashes when quadrant line is rendered as dashed lines.
      Type: Number
      Range: In pixels

QuadrantLabelTL.description:
Description: This attribute lets you specify the label text of the top-left quadrant.
      Type: String

QuadrantLabelTR.description:
Description: This attribute lets you specify the label text of the top-right quadrant.
      Type: String

QuadrantLabelBL.description:
Description: This attribute lets you specify the label text of the bottom-left quadrant.
      Type: String

QuadrantLabelBR.description:
Description: This attribute lets you specify the label text of the bottom-right quadrant.
      Type: String

QuadrantLabelFont.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set the font for all quadrant labels. 

Default value: Base font
      Type: String
      Range: Font Name

QuadrantLabelTLFont.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set the font for the top-left quadrant label. 

Default value: Base font
      Type: String
      Range: Font Name

QuadrantLabelTRFont.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set the font for the top-right quadrant label. 

Default value: Base font
      Type: String
      Range: Font Name

QuadrantLabelBLFont.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set the font for the bottom-left quadrant label. 

Default value: Base font
      Type: String
      Range: Font Name

QuadrantLabelBRFont.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set the font for the bottom-right quadrant label. 

Default value: Base font
      Type: String
      Range: Font Name

QuadrantLabelFontColor.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set the font color for all quadrant labels. 

Default value: Base font color
      Type: Hex Color Code

QuadrantLabelTLFontColor.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set the font color for the top-left quadrant label. 

Default value: Base font color
      Type: Hex Color Code

QuadrantLabelTRFontColor.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set the font color for the top-right quadrant label. 

Default value: Base font color
      Type: Hex Color Code

QuadrantLabelBLFontColor.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set the font color for the bottom-left quadrant label. 

Default value: Base font color
      Type: Hex Color Code

QuadrantLabelBRFontColor.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set the font color for the bottom-right quadrant label. 

Default value: Base font color
      Type: Hex Color Code

QuadrantLabelFontAlpha.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set the font transparency of all quadrant labels. 

Default value: 100
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

QuadrantLabelTLFontAlpha.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set the font transparency of the top-left quadrant label. 

Default value: 100
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

QuadrantLabelTRFontAlpha.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set the font transparency of the top-right quadrant label. 

Default value: 100
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

QuadrantLabelBLFontAlpha.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set the font transparency of the bottom-left quadrant label. 

Default value: 100
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

QuadrantLabelBRFontAlpha.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set the font transparency of the bottom-right quadrant label. 

Default value: 100
      Type: Number
      Range: 0 - 100

QuadrantLabelFontSize.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set the font size for all quadrant labels. 

Default value: Base font size
      Type: Number

QuadrantLabelTLFontSize.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set the font size for the top-left quadrant label. 

Default value: Base font size
      Type: Number

QuadrantLabelTRFontSize.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set the font size for the top-right quadrant label. 

Default value: Base font size
      Type: Number

QuadrantLabelBLFontSize.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set the font size for the bottom-left quadrant label. 

Default value: Base font size
      Type: Number

QuadrantLabelBRFontSize.description:
Description: This attribute lets you set the font size for the bottom-right quadrant label. 

Default value: Base font size
      Type: Number

QuadrantLabelFontBold.description:
Description: This attribute lets you specify whether the label text for all quadrants will be bold formatted.  

Default value: 0 (not formatted in bold)
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

QuadrantLabelTLFontBold.description:
Description: This attribute lets you specify whether the top-left quadrant label text will be bold formatted.  

Default value: 0 (not formatted in bold)
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

QuadrantLabelTRFontBold.description:
Description: This attribute lets you specify whether the top-right quadrant label text will be bold formatted.  

Default value: 0 (not formatted in bold)
      Type: Boolean

YFormatNumber.description:
Description: This configuration determines whether the numbers displayed on the y-axis of the chart will be formatted using commas, e.g., 40,000 if 'formatNumber': '1'; and 40000 if 'formatNumber': '0';. If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from `formatNumber` attribute.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

XFormatNumber.description:
Description: This configuration determines whether the numbers displayed on the x-axis of the chart will be formatted using commas, e.g., 40,000 if 'formatNumber': '1'; and 40000 if 'formatNumber': '0';. If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from `formatNumber` attribute.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

YFormatNumberScale.description:
Description: Configuration whether to add K (thousands) and M (millions) to a number after truncating and rounding it on the y-axis - e.g., if `yFormatNumberScale` is set to 1, 1043 will become 1.04K (with decimals set to 2 places). Same with numbers in millions - an M will be added at the end. If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from `formatNumberScale` attribute.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

XFormatNumberScale.description:
Description: Configuration whether to add K (thousands) and M (millions) to a number after truncating and rounding it on the x-axis - e.g., if `xFormatNumberScale` is set to 1, 1043 will become 1.04K (with decimals set to 2 places). Same with numbers in millions - an M will be added at the end. If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from `formatNumberScale` attribute.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

YDefaultNumberScale.description:
Description: The default unit of the numbers of the y-axis that you're providing to the chart. If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from `defaultNumberScale` attribute.
      Type: String

XDefaultNumberScale.description:
Description: The default unit of the numbers of the x-axis that you're providing to the chart. If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from `defaultNumberScale` attribute.
      Type: String

YNumberScaleUnit.description:
Description: Unit of each block of the scale of the y-axis. If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from `numberScaleUnit` attribute.
      Type: String

XNumberScaleUnit.description:
Description: Unit of each block of the scale of the x-axis. If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from `numberScaleUnit` attribute.
      Type: String

XScaleRecursively.description:
Description: Whether to scale the number recursively for the x-axis? This attribute will work only if the attribute `xAxisLabelMode` is set to '`AUTO`' or '`MIXED`'.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1

XMaxScaleRecursion.description:
Description: How many recursions to complete during recursive scaling for the numbers on the x-axis? -1 completes the entire set of recursion.
      Type: Number

XScaleSeparator.description:
Description: This attribute is used to specify the character that will be used to separate the scales that are generated after recursion for the numbers on the x-axis.
      Type: String

YNumberScaleValue.description:
Description: Range of the various blocks that constitute the y-axis scale. If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from `numberScaleValue` attribute.
      Type: String

XNumberScaleValue.description:
Description: Range of the various blocks that constitute the x-axis scale. If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from `numberScaleValue` attribute.
      Type: String

YNumberPrefix.description:
Description: Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers visible on the y-axis. For example, to represent all dollars figure on the y-axis, you could specify this attribute to $ to show like $40000, $50000. If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from `numberPrefix` attribute.
      Type: String
      Range: Character

XNumberPrefix.description:
Description: Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers visible on the x-axis. For example, to represent all dollars figure on the x-axis, you could specify this attribute to $ to show like $40000, $50000. If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from `numberPrefix` attribute.
      Type: String
      Range: Character

YNumberSuffix.description:
Description: Using this attribute, you could add a suffix to all the numbers visible on the y-axis. For example, to represent all figure quantified as per annum on the y-axis, you could specify this attribute to '/a' to show like 40000/a, 50000/a. If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from `numberSuffix` attribute.
      Type: String
      Range: Character

XNumberSuffix.description:
Description: Using this attribute, you could add a suffix to all the numbers visible on the x-axis. For example, to represent all figure quantified as per annum on the x-axis, you could specify this attribute to '/a' to show like 40000/a, 50000/a.If this attribute is not specifically mentioned, the chart inherits the default value from `numberSuffix` attribute.
      Type: String
      Range: Character

BtnZoomInToolText.description:
Description: Sets the tooltext for the zoom in button. 

__Default value__: Zoom in Or double-click on plot to zoom-in
      Type: String

BtnSelectZoomToolText.description:
Description: Sets the tooltext for the selected zoom icon of the toggle button. 

__Default value__: Select a region to zoom-in. Click to enable pan mode.
      Type: String

BtnPanToolText.description:
Description: Sets the tooltext for the pan icon in the toggle button.  

__Default value__: Drag to move across chart. Click to enable select-zoom mode.
      Type: String

DrawLine.description:
Description: You can opt to connect the scatter points of any dataset using lines. This attribute helps you configure that.
      Type: Boolean
      Range: 0/1
